hyp: New China Times Review: Making Excellent Returning Rural Workers a Vital Force for Rural Revitalization - Xinhua News Agency
Talent is the key to revitalizing the countryside.
Where do you find talent?
Excellent returning migrant workers are an indispensable vital force.
Xinhua News Agency
Xinhua News Agency, Chengdu, July 26 , by wire TITLE: Putting the excellent returning farmer workers into the countryside revitalizing vital force

The 34-year-old Zhang Xiong family lives in Fruit Garden Village, Meishan City, Sichuan Province. In 2010, he quit his ten-thousand-yuan-a-month job in Beijing and went back to his hometown to start a business.

After several years of struggle, he now manages a family-run vineyard that earns more than a million dollars a year, becoming a well-known and wealthy leader, and was elected to the village's "two-committee" class.

In recent years, under the stimulus of a series of supportive and beneficial farming policies such as the country's fight against poverty and the revitalization of the countryside, more and more excellent farmer workers like Zhang Xiang have chosen to go back to their hometowns to start up businesses, stimulating a spring flood in the countryside.

In 2019 alone, more than 8,000 village Party branch secretaries were generated from the returning excellent peasant workers, 61,000 village reserve forces were nurtured, and more than 20,000 Party members were developed, providing a powerful guarantee for winning the fight against poverty and implementing the strategy of rural revitalization.
Well-off is not well-off, the key is to look at the countryside.
Since the reform and opening-up, a large number of young and old workers in rural China have gone out to work to increase their income, and some have founded their own enterprises by struggling.

But objectively, it also leads to rural "emptyness" to varying degrees, especially the weakening of rural grassroots organizations, and the village party branch secretaries and party members' teams all show the characteristics of "one old and one young", i.e., age aging, low education, the village party organization leader's team is not strong, and the problem of non-acceptance of green and yellow is prominent.
If the countryside talents and other factors have been flowing to the city one-way, the countryside is in a state of "bloodlessness" and "anemia" for a long time, revival is an empty word.

Attracting back those peasants who are capable, conscious and willing to serve their hometowns, guiding them back to their hometowns to start a business and become leaders in making them rich, and cultivating them into Party members and rural cadres, and enriching the cadre corps at the grass-roots level, are the measures to solve the problem of the incompatibility between the cadre corps at the grass-roots level and the Party organization at the grass-roots level.
Outstanding migrant workers will be attracted back, but they will also be able to stay and do well.

In recent years, Sichuan Province has started to crack down on the establishment of the peasant workers' party and, on the basis of strict selection criteria, has established a system of attracting excellent peasant workers, guaranteeing their services, training them to improve their skills, selecting and using them, etc., so that they can improve their abilities, secure their jobs and have hope for life.

This year is the year of taking office, which is the year of fighting the fight against poverty and strengthening the link between fighting poverty and revitalizing the countryside, and talents are the key factors.

The Party committee governments at all levels should attach great importance to this group of outstanding returning rural migrant workers and, through comprehensive measures, make them into a workforce that can stay alive, fight and carry on, and a vital army, thus providing strong organizational guarantees and talent support for rural people escaping poverty and striving for well-being and development.

Because of the epidemic, this year's graduation ceremony is a very special one. On July 11,bilibili Summer Graduation Song Festival brings a special live performance for the graduates, old wolf, Park Shu, Li Yuchun, Mao Qiu and other musicians to the graduation ceremony singing and blessing.
Seal Wu, a well-known up-and-comer, also brought along "Wild Grass," a lyrical song he wrote based on Lu Xun's collection of prose poems of the same name, which is very popular among young people.
Due to the epidemic, many graduates have not been able to experience the ceremony of digging ears and awarding degree certificates on the spot, they have transferred the ceremony to the Internet.

"Follow your heart, seize the opportunity, ignore the consequences, sometimes there will be unexpected gains.
Although it is a graduation song party, many songs also make the unfit graduates moved.
"The whole scene really makes me want to cry. Everyone's youth is full of beauty and regret, but it's worth remembering.
Beijing's natural ecology continues to attract more than 500 species of wildlife to " settle " - China News Agency
Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief Responsibility Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief Beijing Youth Daily
Capital's natural ecology continues to flourish, attracting wildlife to the city's "settlement"
There are over 500 species of wildlife in Beijing

In recent years, as the capital's natural ecosystem continues to improve, the species and number of wildlife have continued to increase, according to a Beijing Youth Daily reporter with the City Gardens and Greening Bureau.

At present, the number of terrestrial vertebrate wildlife inhabiting Beijing has increased to more than 500 species, including nationally protected species such as brown cockroaches, black storks, and nationally protected species such as gazelle, big swan, grey crane and duck.

Whether planted in one of the city’s forests in the second ring, or in small wetlands embedded between buildings, it not only brings the city’s citizens a sense of wilderness, but also attracts wildlife to “settle” in the city.
During the peak of summer, it is located in the Yanshan Mountains in the northwest of Yanqing District in the Matsuyama National Nature Reserve.
A swallow was playing by the stream, and beside him two badgers were fighting with each other.

As of the end of 2019, there are 178 species of wildlife living in the green sea covering more than 6,200 hectares, including gold carvings of nationally protected animals and scoop chickens and antelopes of nationally protected animals. Nearly a third of the city's wildlife species can be seen here, said Hu Qiali, director of the Matsuyama National Nature Reserve Administration.
"In Matsuyama, the wild animals are the real 'owners' and our staff can only be the 'guardians' at best," he said.

Mr. Hu said more than 30 professional rangers patrol the area every day, along 16 carefully designed protected routes, and a "roundabout" every month, travelling almost the entire day to get to know the wildlife in the area on the ground.
"In addition to documenting biodiversity, inspections include installation of artificial bird nests, rescue of injured wildlife, installation of outdoor infrared cameras, and so on.
More than 200 infrared cameras have been installed in Matsuyama National Nature Reserve to record the state of wildlife in the forest.

As the biodiversity of the protected areas has become increasingly rich in recent years, more and more wild animals have been featured in the film, and leopard cats, rhinos and badgers have become regular guests.

Zhang Zhiming, director of the Wildlife and Wetland Protection Department of the Beijing Botanical Greening Bureau, said that the number of terrestrial vertebrate wildlife in Beijing has increased from 461 species in 1994 to more than 500, and the number of wildlife species in Beijing has been increasing steadily in recent years.
The appearance of wild animals in the city is becoming more and more common, and it is closely related to the recent upgrading of urban greening in the capital.

In particular, a new round of million-acre afforestation and greening construction, which began in 2018, proposes to reshape the urban ecological environment, enhance the ecological function of forest lands and green spaces, and highlight the "near nature" concept.

Planning efforts are made to interact with the surrounding greenery to facilitate wildlife "going to visit friends and relatives," and the trees planted are also the animals' favorite honey source and food source plants.
Black Land "Seed" Out of Agricultural Modernization - Xinhua News Agency
Xinhua News Agency, Harbin, July 26, by wire TITLE: Black land "seed" to modernize agriculture

In the summer, two jets of sprayed pharmaceuticals flew past the 10,000-acre high-yield demonstration field in the second operation station of Friendship Farm's Fifth Management Area, forming two white lines.

The aircraft can spray pesticides on more than 6,000 acres of farmland a day, eight times more efficient than drones and hundreds of times more efficient than man-made ones, said Kong Lingqiang, head of the operations station.

This farm is located in the territory of Friendship County, Heilongjiang Province, China's first food-producing province, from the past "ha-ha" of cutting rice through to the present "long-long" motor sound, Chinese traditional agriculture and farming in this black soil belt has been transformed.
In addition to aircraft, satellites are also used in modern agricultural production on Friendship Farms.

On the one hand, they use satellite remote sensing technology to achieve accurate fertilization, reduce agricultural inputs and reduce pollution; on the other hand, satellite navigation technology can improve the standardized operation level of agricultural machinery fields, Mr. Kong said.
During rice production this year, the farm expanded its satellite-navigated, unmanned-seedling operation from 3,000 acres last year to 30,000 acres.
The technology allows seedlings to be planted more evenly, maximizes the use of sunlight and arable land resources, and saves $16 per acre in labor costs.
In agricultural production, farms have tried new technologies such as informatization and intelligentization, forming the largest agricultural machinery group in China from the ground to the sky.
According to statistics, at present, the total number of farm machinery holdings is 49,000 units (pieces), and the combined mechanization rate of the fields reaches 99.8%.
Agricultural machinery operations have achieved 100% GPS satellite navigation, 100% precision sowing in arid fields, and 100% operation of large-scale locomotives in arid fields.
Green agriculture, intelligent agriculture and digital agriculture are the directions of agricultural modernization.
said Friendship Farm Manager Liu Hualian.
The key to agricultural modernization lies in scientific and technological progress.

In recent years, Heilongjiang Agricultural Reclamation, which is represented by farms, has played a demonstration and leading role as a "carrier" of modern large-scale agriculture, and has initially established a modern agricultural industrial system dominated by scaled-up cultivation, standardized production, and industrialized operation.
In the outskirts of Friendship County, there is an agricultural machinery exhibition park covering an area of 350,000 square meters.
More than 140 agricultural machinery (parts) imported and used by Heilongjiang Agricultural Reclamation have been exhibited here.
These agricultural machinery and farms witnessed China's agricultural modernization development course.
"Small family for everyone - Jiangkou River in Anhui transferred to Wei people direct hit" (in Chinese). wikipedia.org.
Xinhua News Agency, Hefei, July 26, by wire TITLE: She Xiaojia for everyone - Anhui Hefei Jiangkou River Lianwei mass transfer direct hit
Xinhua News Agency reporters Chen Shangying, Wang Liwu, Liu Xiacun
More than four o'clock in the afternoon on July 25, Fu Qunbao, dressed in mud-stained rubber shoes, from the front to the back, and his wife, Zhou Yan, went back and forth to tidy up.
"I got a phone call from the village cadres asking me to move, and I'm still grazing in the fields.
Fu Qunbao says he has turned over more than 60 acres of land and planted rice. He is in good shape right now. " Yesterday I took some medicine and I haven't packed any tools yet.
Fu Qunbao pointed to the pesticide sprayer in the corner. No one wants to be flooded at home.

To cope with the continuing high water level pressure and possible heavy rainfall in Neshu Lake, Hefei, Anhui Province, is preparing to open the Jiangkou River joint pond, where Fu Kunbao's family resides, on the 26th.
Jiangkou River Lianwei is located in Hexi County, adjacent to the Great Embankment of Lake Nest.
Thousands of villagers in Yandian Township and Sanhe Township need to be relocated.
As of 16 o'clock on the 25th, the water level of Nest Lake, the fifth largest freshwater lake in China, remained at a high level of 13.2 meters, exceeding the guaranteed water level of 0.7 meters.
The kitchen was clean and tidy, with a bowl of cucumbers on the table and eggs and some hazelnuts in the fridge.
“I didn’t expect to move, and the water in Jiangkou River looks fine.”
Zhou Yan said the house is flat, some large objects have not yet thought about where to put.
"Put your valuables in order, and put refrigerators and TV sets in your high-rise neighbors' or relatives' homes for a while.
The village official Wang Li stabbed Fu Qunbao with an idea.
Wang was responsible for the transfer and resettlement of 13 villagers, notifying each of them and confirming their resettlement plans.
The nearest settlement to the Fu Kun Bao family is Yandian Township Su Xiao Primary School, about 2 km away.
In addition to large items, Fu Qunbao has two headaches at home more than 1,000 kilograms of food and some newly bought furniture.
"The food is being hauled to relatives' houses, and the furniture can't be moved.
After some discussion, the couple put a stool under the newly bought bed and raised it about half a meter.
At 6:00 p.m., Fu Qunbao began to transport things to relatives' homes in a tricycle, and Zhou Yan continued to pack at home.
More than eleven o'clock in the evening, the couple looked around the house, pulled on the electrical lock, and prepared to settle down.
I hope the water will recede sooner.
said Fu Qunbao.
On July 26, at 9:30 a.m., reporters in the Jiangkou River Lianwei site saw that the locals had made preparations before the flooding.

Parish Volunteers Recognize Arson at Church of Notre Dame in France-Chinanews.net

On July 18, the famous St. Peter and St. Paul's Cathedral, a jewel of religious and historical buildings in Nantes, France, was severely damaged in a fire and the organ completely destroyed, foreign media reported.
Local time, on 26 April, Attorney General Nate announced that a parish volunteer who was responsible for guarding the cathedral had been indicted on charges of "inciting arson and destruction".
He has admitted that it was he who lit the fire in the church.
The 39-year-old parish volunteer from Rwanda admitted he lit three fires in the cathedral at night, local prosecutors said.
The man's lawyer said the arsonists now regretted doing so.
Several years ago, the man entered France by way of asylum, was given shelter in the diocese where the fire occurred, and was taken into the church.
Prosecutors noted that he had recently attempted to renew his visa and was in dialogue with the police.
But the church said it still didn't believe that a believer who was usually very kind and smiling, but didn't talk much, would destroy the church he loved so much.
On the day of the fire on July 18, the volunteer had been questioned by the police because of an illogical question in his account, but was later released.
The picture shows the firefighters rescuing the victims at the scene.
On the evening of the 25th, the man was again interrogated, as new evidence was obtained from a professional engineer at the laboratory of the Central Bureau of Police in Paris.
This time, the man confessed to arson.
If convicted of arson, the suspect could face a 10-year prison sentence and a €150,000 fine.
The fire reportedly caused severe damage to the cathedrals of St. Pierre and St. Paul, where the organ was completely destroyed and the stained glass windows behind the organ were severely damaged.
The chief architect of the French Historical Preservation Building, Jean-Baptiste Brunet, estimated that the restoration of the cathedral would take at least three years.
"U.S. unilateralism undermines U.S.-China relations" (Press release).

On the morning of July 24, the Chinese Foreign Ministry informed the U.S. Embassy in China that China has decided to revoke the permit for the establishment and operation of the U.S. Consulate General in Chengdu and to make specific requests for the Consulate General to cease all operations and activities.

The international public opinion believes that the unilateralist measures adopted by the United States have caused serious trouble in the relations between China and the United States, and that China's response to the unreasonable provocation by the United States and the adoption of countermeasures are legitimate and necessary.

'U.S. unilateralism has damaged the bridge of understanding between the peoples of China and the U.S.,' said Andrea Borges, director of the Center for China Studies at the University of Chile's Institute for International Studies.
China's announcement of the closure of the US Consulate General in Chengdu is contrary to U.S. unilateral measures and in line with diplomatic practice.

Patricio Giusto, professor at the Catholic University of Argentina and director of the Center for Sino-Arab Studies, said China's decision was a legitimate and necessary countermeasure to the U.S.'s previous provocation, and not aimed at ordinary Americans.
The US is trying to divert American attention by pressuring China to cover up its weaknesses in dealing with the new crown disease.

'The U.S. has taken a provocative diplomatic stance, which has caused serious trouble in relations between China and the U.S., and the two countries face serious challenges,' said Banpong Suryono, president of the Asia Innovation Research Center of the Indonesian think tank.

China's notification to the United States of the closure of its Consulate General in Chengdu is a normal countermeasures, in line with diplomatic practice, reflecting China's principled position of resolutely safeguarding its own interests, as well as the rationality and efficiency of Chinese diplomacy.
Tanzanian current affairs commentator Francis Semwinza said China's decision was a legitimate and necessary response to the U.S. provocation.
If China-US relations are to return to normal, the US should take the initiative to improve relations with China and stop interfering in China's internal affairs.
The United States should focus on how to win economically and politically with China and how to benefit both peoples and the international community as a whole.

Ali Yousef, executive director of the Sudan-based Arab-China Friendship Association, said the countermeasures China was forced to take were a legitimate and necessary response to America's unreasonable actions, in line with international law and the basic norms of international relations, as well as diplomatic practice.
The US had previously demanded the closure of China's consulate-general in Houston, in grave violation of international law and basic norms of international relations.
It is hoped that the U.S. will reverse its earlier decision and create the necessary conditions for normal relations between the two countries.
'The U.S.'s bigger strategic intention is to block China and prevent it from continuing to rise,' Singapore's United Morning Post said in an editorial.
Faced with the increasing pressure from the U.S., China, while reluctant to see Sino-US relations continue to deteriorate, has had to take countermeasures.
(Interviewers: Yin Nan, Zhang Xianren, Ni Rui Jie, Liang Hui, Gao Zhu, Lis Bo, Ma Yi Chong, Wang Lili)

Xinhua news agency reported by wire in Guangzhou on July 26 (reporter Mao Xin) that the Guangdong Maritime Police Bureau, in conjunction with the Guangzhou Customs and Public Security Department, has recently cracked down on a large-scale oil smuggling syndicate, initially verifying that the syndicate has smuggled about 120,000 tons of oil since 2019, with a case value of about 800 million yuan and tax evasion amounting to about 2.4 billion yuan.
The Guangdong Marine Police Bureau and the Customs and Excise Department have gradually worked out the division of labour and organizational structure of the gang.

On July 8, the maritime police, customs and public security departments conducted unified interception operations in Guangzhou, Foshan, etc., and the Pearl River estuary, respectively, to seize four suspected smuggling vessels on the spot, seize 4,700 tons of finished oil from the vessels and oil refineries involved, respectively, and freeze a number of financial accounts.

It is understood that in this joint operation, a total of eight ships and two helicopters were deployed, divided into several operational teams to cooperate in combating maritime smuggling, land-based illegal operations and other links, and 35 major criminal suspects were all on the case.
The case is currently being investigated further.

The head of the Guangdong Maritime Police Bureau said that in the future, it will continue to maintain a high-pressure situation, combat all kinds of smuggling illegal and criminal activities at sea, and maintain good order in the waters under its jurisdiction.
Hurricane Hanna made landfall in the state or triggered river surges and mountain flooding - CNN
Hurricane Hanna made landfall in Texas at 5:00 p.m. local time on July 25, causing heavy rainfall, river flooding and potentially life-threatening mountain flooding.

The National Hurricane Center said Hurricane Hanna was expected to carry heavy rainfall, sweeping parts of southern and northeastern Texas, raising rainfall or triggering stream surges and life-threatening flash flooding.
Hurricane Hanna reportedly affected the area south of Corpus Christi to the mouth of the Grand River, and the Rio Grande Valley was likely to experience widespread flooding.
"Any hurricane is a huge challenge," Governor Robert Abbott said on Sunday.
Thirty-two counties in the state were declared disaster-prone as a result of the hurricane.
The city of Corpus Christi, with a population of over 320,000, has closed its libraries and museums, and residents are on the move.
Mr. Abbott also said the hurricane could not be allowed to cause more deaths in Texas at a time when the state was suffering from a new crown disease.
It was reported that rainfall in southern Texas was expected to reach 6 to 12 inches overnight on the 26th, with 3 to 5 inches in northern Texas and coastal Louisiana.
Due to global warming and other factors, Hanna formed earlier than the previous Atlantic hurricane season.
Typically, the first Atlantic hurricane does not form until mid-August.
Poland to Withdraw from Europe's Violence Against Women Treaty
The Polish Ministry of Justice said Saturday that Poland would take steps next week to withdraw from the European treaty to prevent violence against women.
The right-wing Polish cabinet said the treaty violated the rights of students' parents by requiring schools to teach students about gender issues.
At a press conference, Poland's Attorney General, Piotr Joblow, said his Ministry of Justice would ask the Ministry of Labour and the Family to begin withdrawing from the treaty on Monday.
The treaty was also known as the Istanbul Convention.
"The treaty contains elements that we think are harmful in terms of their morphology," Joublot said.
The Polish ruling Law and Justice Party and its ruling coalition partners have a close alliance with the Roman Catholic Church, advocating a conservative social agenda.
During his successful re-election campaign this month, Polish President Aleksander Duda made hostility to gay rights one of his top priorities.
On Friday, tens of thousands of Poles, most of them women, held protests in Warsaw and other cities against the withdrawal from the convention.
One of the organizers of the protest, Liam Patt, said during a protest march in Warsaw that "the aim of withdrawing from the treaty is to legalize domestic violence".
Some protesters held banners that read, "The Law and Justice Party is women's hell."
The leader of the Law and Justice Party has long complained about the Istanbul Convention.
Poland's previous centre-right government ratified the convention in 2015.
The government of the Law and Justice Party says the treaty does not respect religion and requires liberal social policies to be taught in schools.
So far, however, the party has not decided to withdraw from the convention.
(According to Reuters)
"Brazilian President's new coronavirus test results confirmed".
Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva announced on his personal social media account on July 25 that his latest test for the new crown virus was negative, Xinhua reported.
In addition to announcing the latest test results, Bosonaro also posted photos of himself holding a box of hydrochlorobenzene on social media.
Bosonaro has consistently argued that the drug is effective in treating new coronavirus infections and has repeatedly demonstrated his use of the drug live on social media.
According to Brazilian media reports, Bosonaro announced the results of the virus test on the day after driving a motorcycle to the capital, Brasilia, to meet with a member of parliament.
Prior to this, Bossonaro had been housed in a separate office at the presidential palace.
Bosono himself tested positive for the new crown virus on June 6, and tested again on the 14th and 21st, both of which were positive, he announced on a joint live broadcast of local media on July 7.
"Singapore launches 'Green Corridor' to fight floods" (PDF).

The recruitment office of the Jiangxi Provincial People's Government has recently made it clear that priority will be given to those individuals or their children who stand out in the flood-fighting and disaster-rescue tasks, meet the requirements for recruitment, and pass both medical examinations and political examinations, Xinhua news agency reported by wire in Nanchang on July 26.

"After the applicants are registered, we will jointly verify the applicants' communities, the armed forces of the streets and the military recruitment offices in Xunyang District and assign priority to them," he said.

Wang Hui, deputy minister of the People's Armed Forces Department in Xunyang District of Jiujiang City, said they had concentrated on organizing a three-day medical examination for young people who had been affected by the flooding since 25th.

Zhou Qianfan, a 22-year-old university graduate from Xunyang District, Jiujiang City, whose mother is a community worker and whose father is a retired soldier in the Air Force, has been on duty for more than a decade.
These days, when I see in the news that the people's children and young soldiers are bravely defending their hometown against the floods, I want to be like them.
Zhou said he had had a military dream since he was a child, and through this flood fighting strengthened his determination to enlist in the army.

The city of Jiujiang also uses flood prevention as a "living teaching material" for recruiting soldiers.They use the community as a unit and call on young people to volunteer for patrolling and checking dikes, on duty and on guard duty.They now understand the nature and purpose of the People's Army and firmly believe that they will join the army to report to the state.

"We hope to motivate more young people to join the army and create a good social atmosphere for them to take part in the mission and join the army," said Luo Jiuyu, Political Commissioner of the People's Armed Forces Department in Xunyang District, Jiujiang City.
According to the Vietnam News Agency, Mr. Grewley believes Vietnam has made a significant contribution to ASEAN's development over the past 25 years.
Vietnam is not only a responsible member of ASEAN, but also an ASEAN locomotive.
Mr. Gryvori said that Russia and even the AEU believe that Vietnam is contributing to ASEAN by raising its profile and promoting its image abroad.
ASEAN should therefore thank Vietnam, he stressed.

Between now and the end of 2020, Beijiang Province will have the necessary conditions, especially in infrastructure, human resources and land, to welcome inflows of foreign capital, especially multinational groups with value chains and transfer of advanced technologies.

In addition, Beijiang Province will submit to the Prime Minister of the Government the proposal for investment in infrastructure construction and operational projects in Vietnam's industrial zone and approve the document on the comprehensive plan for the development of Vietnam's industrial zone by 2020 to include the two industrial-urban-services zones in the province, Anshan-Beilong and Anhui.

At the same time, Beijiang province has been working hard to accelerate the progress of various projects, especially infrastructure construction and operation projects in industrial park clusters such as Hefu, Gwangju, and Shuangxi-Nehuang, forming land funds for attracting investment.

By 2020, the Northern Jiang Province Bureau of Trade and Industry will be involved in formulating proposals for the designation of industrial zones and industrial clusters to be incorporated into provincial planning.

The province has determined that the development of clusters of industrial parks will be combined with the safeguarding of national defense, the protection of the ecological environment and the safeguarding of food security, thereby contributing to the balanced development of industry; it will have comprehensive electricity, water supply, transportation and telecommunications infrastructure, and will be combined with other social infrastructure such as urban construction, trade services, workers' housing and medical and health care, and education.

In the industrial areas, Beijiang province has focused on appealing for investment projects in high-tech and clean technology in the fields of electricity, electronics, telecommunications equipment, precision machinery, and auxiliary industries.

In clusters of industrial parks, the province has called for small- and medium-scale investment projects in the production and utilization of local labor, especially in agricultural products and food processing.

In the future, Beijiang will focus on accelerating investment in the infrastructure of Beijiang Logistics Center, which will be developed in synergy with the clusters of industrial parks, in order to optimize the flow of goods and money and help reduce production costs, increase the value of goods, optimize supply chains and develop multimodal transportation, thereby creating an attractive environment for investors to invest in the province.
Russian Armed Helicopter Carrier-52M (Russian: Кар-52М) is a Russian armed helicopter.

According to a Russian defense ministry plan, the upgraded version of the Russian armed helicopter, the Ka-52M, will be converted for the first time in December and shipped out of the factory, with significant improvements in reconnaissance, communications and weapons performance.

The first two of the upgraded versions are undergoing refurbishment at the Far Eastern Helicopter Manufacturing Plant of the Russian Progressive Aerospace Group, with national testing and refit completion expected by October 2022.

It is understood that the above-mentioned upgrade work Russian experts introduced, the "ancestor" of the "Super Short Kiss Crocodile" - Wu Zika-52 was formally installed in November 2011, the aircraft model exposed some weaknesses in use, this modification upgrade is to "complement the short board".

Compared to the Ka-52, the Ka-52M will be partially armored with new, weight-resistant defense materials, its cockpit will be reinforced and equipped with new missile-defense equipment, thereby increasing the likelihood of survival in the battlefield; more powerful generators will be installed to power more sophisticated airborne electronic equipment; optical and electro-optical systems will be upgraded to detect and identify more distant battlefield targets; a new lightweight multi-purpose missile with a range of 20 kilometers will be equipped with the main attack armoured fighting vehicles and reinforced concrete fortifications, which will increase the range of similar missiles used directly by the Russian armed forces by about one-fold; and its defense weapons and communications equipment will be as common as possible with the M-28NM armed helicopters that can
In addition, the Ka-52M will have more advanced electronic guidance systems, weapon sighting systems, and navigation equipment.

Russian experts also said it was of concern that the Ka-52M would be equipped with communications equipment to communicate with UAVs, thereby obtaining real-time information transmitted by nearby UAVs in the air, such as images taken by the UAVs on the helicopter's cabin screen.

As planned, the Ka-52M's pilots would be able to directly control the UAVs that would accompany them, thereby improving the pilot's command of the battlefield situation and the guidance of long-range missiles.

Xinhua News Agency in Shijiazhuang, July 26 (reporter Wang Kun) learned from the Hebei Province Water Conservancy Office that since this year, Hebei Province has co-ordinated the utilization of guiding river water and local reservoir water, and successively implemented ecological recharge water to 28 rivers such as the Wutuo River, the Tang River, the Zhima River and the Baiyang Dian, the cumulative completion of river and lake ecological recharge water 17.5 billion cubic meters.

Hebei Province has seized the favorable moment of increasing the flow of water from the South Water-North Diversion Central Line Project, and used the Drainage River water to the Tang River, the Sha River, the Jinlong River and other rivers to carry out ecological water replenishment.

Through supervised inspection and concentrated secret visits, all kinds of problems are solved in time, ensuring the safety and order of river water supply.

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) issued an emergency airworthiness directive on April 24, requiring an emergency inspection of approximately 2,000 Boeing 737NG and 737 Classic aircraft registered in the United States.

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said it had received four reports of aircraft engines being parked in the air on the 737NG and 737 Classic models to date, prompting an emergency inspection request for aircraft that had been parked for seven consecutive days or more and that had flown fewer than 11 flights since re-entry into service.

The Federal Aviation Administration warned that if the Class 5 check valve of all two engines on the aircraft were damaged, it could be stuck in the open position, causing the aircraft to lose all power and unable to restart the engine.
The aviation regulator has ordered airlines to replace this key component before the aircraft can be put back into service once it is found to be corroded.

Boeing responded later that day that the outbreak of the new plague had reduced travel demand, resulting in many passenger flights being blocked or used less frequently, and that “return valves were more susceptible to corrosion.”
Boeing also says it has advised airlines to inspect the aircraft involved in the instruction, and will provide assistance with repairs and replacement of check valves if problems are found.

Major U.S. carriers usually fly more than one flight a day, but large numbers of flights have been grounded in the wake of the outbreak, the Associated Press reported, and some have reopened as demand for travel has grown slowly lately.
The Federal Aviation Administration did not release the details of four aerial parking reports.
Alaska Airlines revealed one of the incidents later that night.
The airline said in a statement that an engine suddenly went out on a July 15 flight from Seattle, Washington, to Austin, Texas, and the aircraft finally made an emergency landing at Austin Airport.
Alaska Airlines said it had replaced the aircraft's engines and had inspected six aircraft's engines as directed by the Federal Aviation Administration.
U.S. Airlines, United Airlines and Southwest Airlines said on Tuesday that their aircraft did not experience engine failures associated with air-return valves.
Four American Airlines aircraft will be inspected and 28 United Airlines aircraft will be inspected.
Delta Air Lines said it would inspect 20 of its aircraft, but did not say if there had been any engine failures.
Several media outlets reported that the Federal Aviation Administration's Emergency Airworthiness Directive was another blow to Boeing.
Indonesian Lion Airlines and Ethiopian Airlines each crashed their Boeing 737 MAX aircraft in October 2018 and March 2019, killing a total of 346 people.
The series was subsequently discontinued worldwide, and production ceased in January and resumed in May.
In June, Federal Aviation Administration Director Steve Dickson admitted that, in the case of the 737 MAX, the agency had “made a mistake” in regulating Boeing.

Secretary for Administration of the HKSAR Government: The situation is serious and we are doing our utmost to combat the epidemic-CNN

Zhang Jianzong, the Secretary for Administration of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSARG), said on July 26 that the epidemic situation in Hong Kong remained severe and that if the epidemic worsened, the HKSARG would resolutely take more stringent control measures to further restrict business operations and reduce the public's space to go out.
At this stage, however, the HKSAR Government has no intention of introducing a "household order" or "footwear ban" to restrict citizens from going out.

He said the outbreak was the worst in half a year and that the next two weeks would be crucial to try to prevent further spread of the virus in the community.

He called on the public to stay at home as much as possible, reduce social contact and eat out.

Members of the public should protect themselves and others with the mandatory wearing of masks, pay attention to personal and environmental hygiene and hand washing. They should also suspend unnecessary family gatherings or meals and reduce their visits to the markets.

He said that the Central Government has been very concerned about the evolving epidemic situation in Hong Kong and supported the Government's anti-epidemic and anti-epidemic work, and has responded positively to the Chief Executive's latest request to provide assistance in enhancing the detection capability and refurbishing the Asia International Exposition Centre into a similar square-cabin hospital.

Mr Cheung said the free virus testing provided by the HKSAR Government to certain high-risk groups, namely the elderly, disabled and nursing home staff, restaurant staff, taxi drivers and property management staff, had been fully implemented, involving more than 400,000 people.
He was very concerned about the outbreaks in the homes of the elderly. The HKSAR Government had arranged special temporary quarantine centres for the residents of the homes of the elderly.

He said the Government was in the process of constructing quarantine facilities near the Bamboo Bay Quarantine Centre on Lantau Island in the New Territories and expected to provide an additional 700 quarantine rooms by the end of September.

The Chief Executive also announced on 19th that the HKSAR Government will build more than 2,000 quarantine rooms at the Chek Lap Wan Quarantine Centre with a view to completion by the end of this year.

"Segami Jiangnan" Searches for Poetry "Huanghe Dream"-CNN News
(China's Poverty Alleviation Story) "Set Up Jiangnan" to Search for Poetry "The Dream of the Yellow River"
Xinhua News Agency, Yinchuan, July 26 (Yang Di): "There are nine rivers of the Yellow River, sand, waves and winds from the ends of the earth.

The Yellow River, which has given rise to countless literary figures and children, has nurtured the beautiful and fertile Ningxia Plain. Now, Ningxia, which has the reputation of "sealing up Jiangnan," is pursuing the idea of "ecological priority and green development," and is pursuing the poetic "the dream of the Yellow River."
The "Bamboo Dream" of Shimizu Show
The Yellow River flows 397 kilometers through Ningxia, and is the mother river of one of the farms.

However, with the rapid advancement of industrialization and urbanization, the development, utilization and management of rivers and lakes have imbalanced, and disturbances such as excessive discharge of sewage, enclosed lake farming, and encroachment on water bodies have emerged, leading to black odor in water bodies, excessive water quality, environmental pollution, and ecological degradation.
Now, Ningxia is promoting the restoration of water ecosystem diversity, striving to restore the Yellow River's water quality.
Water treatment starts at the source.

In Yinchuan, Ningxia, the local government adopted the "tendering + sewage treatment + strict management" method, all sewage in industrial parks was treated centrally, all urban sewage treatment plants were discharged according to the standard of 1A, black odor water in urban built-up areas was basically eliminated, and the third batch of China's black odor water demonstration cities were successfully declared.

In addition, Ningxia Province implemented the river and lake lengthening system in 2017, and now it has achieved the responsibility system of the five-level river and lake lengthening system in districts, cities, counties and villages, and river and lake lengthening patrols have become the norm.
Gu Jincheng, 64, who lives in a village by the Yellow River, witnessed the change: "The water used to smell bad, but after it was cleaned up, it doesn't smell bad anymore.
Gu Jincheng said the ecological environment is better and his life is more comfortable. Now he and his family often go for a walk by the Yellow River to feel the blue sky.
The "Wetland Dream" of the Sand Gulls
Flying Birds, Green Trees, Stack Roads, Blue Water...The beautiful scenery of Fanzhong's "Sand Gull Xiangshu" has become a reality in the Yellow River Wetland Park in Ningxia's Yinchuan River.

The Yellow River passes through Ningxia and along the way forms a variety of wetlands such as river wetlands, lake wetlands, swamp wetlands, etc. It plays an important role in promoting the rational use of water resources and water ecological balance, and also becomes an important international bird migration route.

Since 2009, Ningxia's relevant departments have invested about 34.5 billion yuan in wetland protection projects.At present, Yinchuan Wetland covers an area of 19.2 million hectares, has a wetland protection rate of 78.5%, has nearly 200 natural lakes and marsh wetland, has five national wetland parks, one national urban wetland park, six autonomous region-level wetland parks, and eight city-level parks.

Liu Jinhu, deputy director of the Yinchuan Wetland Conservation Center, told reporters that wetland conservation has increased biodiversity and is particularly evident in birds. "The gull is an endangered bird, there are only more than 20,000 of them in the world, and more than 2,000 of them inhabit the Yinchuan Wetland.

At the same time, Ningxia Prefecture has legally delineated a 500-meter red line between the two sides of the Yellow River and Yinchuan sections of the wetlands protection area, stipulating that no units or individuals, except for public welfare projects, may carry out development and construction and business activities within the protected area.

Zhao Shaoyong, deputy director of the Yinchuan City Water Conservancy Service Center, said nine of Ningxia's main Yellow Drainage ditches have now achieved 100% Class IV water quality through pollution source control, integrated river and lake ecology management and end-of-river wetland construction. "Now the water is clean, the fish are swimming and the flowers are blooming," he said.
The "Dream of Drinking Water" of the People's Welfare
Ningxia Yinchuan once had an "awkward" nickname: the only city along the Yellow River that "protects the Yellow River from water shortages".

Since 2010, the city of Yinchuan has been facing the problem of water shortage during the continuous summer peak period, and the "pain of water shortage" for nearly a decade has been the summer suffering experience of many high-rise residents, but under the current situation of over-exploitation limits in major water sources and underground underground underground underground water over-exploitation funnel area, water shortage has become a problem plaguing the city of Yinchuan.
Thanks to the improvement of the quality of the Yellow River water, drinking the purified Yellow River water becomes a good solution to the local residents' drinking problems.

Mr Ding Ming, deputy director of Yinchuan City Water Supply Bureau, said that in order to improve the demand for production water for urban and rural residents in Yinchuan, Ningxia Province had launched the Yinchuan Urban and Rural West Line Water Supply Project in a timely manner, replacing the existing groundwater source with high-quality Yellow River water.

"On December 29, 2019, the water supply project was officially opened to the three districts of Yinchuan City, and in 2020, residents of Minning Town and Helan County also drank the Yellow River water."

Ding Ming said the Yinchuan water conservancy department will consider the integration of regional rural drinking water and urban water supply. "Next, we will integrate the dispersed rural water supply points into the West Line water supply project after all, and we expect to achieve the urban-rural integration of the Yinchuan region by the end of this year.

US launches first anti-subsidy investigation against China for "undervaluing the RMB exchange rate"

The U.S. Department of Commerce recently announced it had decided to initiate an anti-dumping and anti-subsidy investigation into bundles of products originating in China, as well as an investigation into "undervaluation of the yuan's exchange rate."
China's Ministry of Commerce said it was the first time the U.S. had filed an anti-subsidy inquiry into a project that allegedly undervalued the renminbi's exchange rate.

The Ministry of Commerce issued a press release on the subject on the evening of the 23rd, saying that China has a floating exchange rate system based on market supply and demand, regulated by reference to a basket of currencies, and that the market plays a decisive role in the formation of the exchange rate.
The press release stressed that, overall, the renminbi's exchange rate was reasonably balanced and not undervalued.
Since 2005, the renminbi has appreciated by more than 17% against the dollar.

According to data released by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), the renminbi's nominal effective exchange rate rose 38% and its real effective exchange rate rose 49% between early 2005 and May 2020, making it the strongest currency in the G20 economies and one of the fastest-growing currencies in the world.
The Ministry of Commerce pointed out that the exchange rate issue exceeds the power of members to conduct anti-subsidy investigations in accordance with World Trade Organization rules.
The United States amended its rules in February to conduct anti-subsidy investigations of other countries' exchange rates, which are suspected of violating WTO rules, amid widespread opposition.

Even under U.S. law, the press release said, the applicant's claim contained a large number of errors and lacked the necessary anti-subsidy elements of financial support, benefit allocation and specialization.
China urged the US to abide by existing international rules and stop conducting anti-subsidy investigations into the so-called “undervaluation of the renminbi exchange rate.”

Due to the further rise in tensions between China and the United States, the renminbi's overseas and overseas exchange rates fell sharply against the U.S. dollar on the 22nd, falling by more than a dollar against the renminbi's exchange rate of 7.0 yuan.
The U.S. Department of Commerce's move to push up the renminbi is cause for concern.
The renminbi's spot exchange rate against the U.S. dollar rose 23 days to 6.9961, above the 7.0 mark.
The officially regulated exchange rate of the renminbi against the U.S. dollar dropped 17 basis points to 6.9938 on the 24th.

Brazil's city of Rio announces cancellation of New Year's celebrations - China News
So far, Brazil has had the second-highest number of confirmed cases and deaths in the world, after the United States, according to the data.
The state of São Paulo, with the highest number of confirmed cases, had nearly 480,000 cases and more than 20,000 deaths.
More than 160,000 and 150,000 cases were diagnosed in Seara and Rio de Janeiro, respectively, and more than 140,000 cases were diagnosed in Pará and Bahia, respectively.
More than 110,000 cases were diagnosed in the states of Maranhão and Minas Gerais.

The mayor of Rio de Janeiro, Marcelo Crivilla, announced on 25 January that the city had decided to cancel the celebrations for the 2021 New Year in view of the spread of the pneumonia epidemic in Brazil and the absence of an effective vaccine.
In the past, the city celebrated New Year's Eve at the famous Copacabana Beach, and the final day of the 2019 New Year's Eve attracted 2.9 million attendees.
At the same time, the city has decided to postpone the 2021 Carnival from next February to September.

The mayor of São Paulo, Bruno Covas, announced on 24 December that the city's New Year's celebrations, originally scheduled to take place on 31 December this year on Callista Avenue, would be cancelled and that Carnival 2021 would be postponed until the end of May or early July of next year.

Mr. Areasa said the U.S. government's recent political, diplomatic, economic and public pressure on China is an unwarranted attack on a sovereign nation.
Mr. Areasa forwarded the comments to Chinese Ambassador to Venezuela Li Baorong, who posted them on his personal account earlier in the day.

"China strongly condemns the US forcible entry into the Consulate General of China in Houston, which is a serious violation of the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations and the Sino-American Consular Treaty," Li said in a tweet.

Government officials, social figures and mainstream media reporters, such as Venezuelan Vice President Rodrigo Malmierca Díaz and Carlos Long, deputy foreign minister in charge of North American affairs, also relayed Li's remarks, condemning the United States' behavior as a serious violation of international law.

On 26 January, the day before President Donald Trump's fifth State of the Union Address (SONA), more than 80,000 new cases of pneumonia were diagnosed in the Philippines, bringing the number of confirmed cases to 25 for the Department of Public Information (PCOO) and its staff.
To this end, the PCOO has specially prepared a working group that has not had any contact with the diagnosis staff, in conjunction with President Duterte's press release on SONA.
PCOO Minister Martin Andanar said in an interview with DZBB Radio on 26 April that two sets of plans had been prepared for the release of the SONA format by President Duterte.
Under Plan A, Duterte will deliver SONA at the Batasang Pambansa building in Quezon City on the afternoon of the 27th.

Due to the epidemic, only 50 seats were reserved for some members of the cabinet and legislators, and a dedicated video conference room was set up for other cabinet members, local government officials, and others to watch.
All attendees had to pass a rapid security check to enter the Capitol building on the same day.
As soon as one of the attendees tested positive, Plan B was activated, with President Duterte announcing SONA at the Presidential Palace in Maracaibo, and fewer seats were allocated.
As usual, SONA broadcasts live to Fiji nationwide.
At the time of writing, the President's Office had not yet confirmed whether Duterte's family would be attending SONA.

Mr. Andanar said President Duterte's SONA will focus on how the government will lead the Philippines in responding to the new cholera epidemic and restoring social and economic life, as well as on his commitments to fight anti-government corruption, illicit drugs and poverty reduction.

Mr Duterte will also outline the government's other plans, including creating more jobs, revitalizing the economy, promoting education, and helping Filipino workers overseas who are suffering from the epidemic.
Yinchuan: Classified measures to support kindergarten teachers' team stability - Official website

Yinchuan, Ningxia Prefecture, has yet to reopen kindergartens as a result of the epidemic, Xinhua news agency said by wire on July 26 (reporter Ai Fumei).In particular, the increasing pressure on privately run kindergartens' funds has had some impact on the stability of the kindergarten teachers' workforce and their future sustainable development.

To this end, Yinchuan City has adopted a number of measures such as pre-allocation of subsidized funds for publicly-run kindergartens, subsidized job security for non-publicly-run kindergartens, and reduced and exempted rents for publicly-run kindergartens to support teachers in these kindergartens.

According to the relevant policies of Yinchuan City, if, during the epidemic period, the organizers of public kindergartens (which have been converted into public kindergartens after the management of supportive kindergartens in urban areas) pay basic living expenses of not less than $1,660 per month to teaching staff in accordance with the minimum wage standards of the three districts, the municipal finance will allocate a six-month subsidy fund to settle teachers' salaries and social insurance expenses in accordance with the standard of 1,000 yuan per student per year for the average funds for public kindergartens, the municipal finance will allocate a six-month subsidy fund to settle teachers' salaries and social insurance expenses.

For non-public private kindergartens, which also provide basic living expenses of not less than $1,660 per person per month to teaching staff, Yinchuan City will allocate six-month subsidy funds as a fixed-term subsidy fund for nursery teachers according to the standard of $500 per student per year.

At the same time, for private kindergartens rented from state-owned assets, Yinchuan City will reduce the rent for three months during the immunization prevention and control period, and encourage developers and other leasing entities to assume social responsibilities.
Formation of the Third Flood of the Yangtze River in 2020 Detailed and Practical Response Measures of the Ministry of Water Resources - China New Network
Xinhua News Agency (Beijing Daily News, July 26) The third flood of the Yangtze River in 2020 formed on July 26.

The Minister of Water Resources, Mr O Keng Ping, at the meeting requested that the Three Gorges Reservoirs be fine-tuned to take into account the influx of water from the upper reaches of the Yangtze River and Lake Dongting, that the misalignment of the reservoirs be implemented, that the reservoirs be maintained in order to prepare for possible heavy floods, and that the flood protection of the lower and middle reaches of the river and the important embankment of Lake Dongting be ensured.

According to forecasts, over the next three days, there will be heavy to heavy rainfall in parts of eastern southwest, southern Jianghuai, northwestern Jiangnan, southeastern Hubei and central Guangxi, including parts of northern Hunan and southwestern Jiangsu, and moderate to heavy rainfall in parts of central western North China, including parts of central Hebei.

The Ministry of Water Resources estimates that, as a result of the flooding, the inflow into the upper Three Gorges Reservoir of the Yangtze River could reach about 60,000 cubic meters per second by 28 days, the water level in the middle reaches of Lianhuatang River and Dongting Lake will rise again and exceed 0.20 meters, the water level in the middle reaches of Huai River will generally subside, and the water level in Hongze Lake will continue to subside, and rivers such as the Daqing River System and Yongding River will experience a process of rising water.
O'Keeping suggested that the Huai River basin should be further extensively drained, and that the water level of Lake Hongze should be reduced as soon as possible.
We should do well to cope with heavy rain and flooding in Yijiang and Sabi Rivers.

He said the Taihu basin should not relax and continue to increase the outflow of flood water, reduce the Taihu and surrounding river network water level as soon as possible, and reduce the risk of Taihu high water level and typhoon.

In addition, he emphasized that the floods in northern areas such as Inner Mongolia and Hebei Province are steeply rising and falling, the early warning time is short, it is very easy to cause landslides and mudslides in mountainous floods, and it is difficult to defend; the number of small and medium-sized reservoirs and silt dams is large, and there are safety dangers.

The Lewis Family: John Lewis was a warrior fighting for the weakest
John Lewis, a U.S. Congressman and civil rights activist, was remembered as a soldier "fighting for the weakest" at a memorial service for him on Saturday (July 25).
Lewis's public memorial service began on Saturday in Alabama.
There were two memorial services on the first day.
At a public memorial service at Troy University in Alabama on Saturday, Lewis's five brothers and sisters and a niece spoke of him as a loving, fearless, and family-oriented man.
Lewis' youngest brother, Henry "Grant" Lewis, said at the meeting: "He's dedicated his life to helping others.
Samuel Lewis said his mother had warned John, "Don't get in trouble, don't get in trouble.

He added that John did not listen to his mother's warning, saying, "We all know that John always gets into trouble, always gets into trouble, but it's because he insists on doing the right thing, it's a good trouble.
Lewis's brothers and sisters reminded people at the memorial that John's best-known argument was to create "good trouble," that is, to raise the issue for the sake of righteousness.
John had applied to Troy University in Troy, Alabama, where he was born, but Troy University, a white school at the time, refused to accept him.
John Lewis, who preached the gospel to chickens on his farm as a child, eventually earned a degree in religion and philosophy from Fisk University.
Many years later, the University of Troy awarded Lewis an honorary doctorate.
Congressman Doug Jones of Alabama said the current protesters were "peacefully, non-violently protesting," as Lewis had done in the Civil Rights Movement.
Jones said: "Even if President Trump overthrew a boatman with a rod and called all the protesters thugs, he was wrong.
The protesters are patriots who want the United States to move towards a more equal nation.
A six-day series of events in honor of Lewis will culminate this week at a funeral in Georgia.
Lewis's coffin was placed on display Saturday at a public memorial service at Troy University to pay tribute to the civil rights pioneer.
Later Saturday, a private ceremony honored him in a small church in Selma, Alabama, followed by an open memorial service.
On Sunday, Lewis' body will pass through Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma.
In 1965, he and demonstrators demanding black voting rights were severely beaten by Alabama police in front of the bridge, who also threw tear gas at the demonstrators.
Lewis was nearly killed.
The day was later known as Bloody Sunday.
Lewis' body will be transported to Montgomery, Alabama.
Mayor Steven Reed encouraged people to line up on the sidewalk and walk with Lewis on the final leg.
At the same time, officials demanded that the public wear masks and stay away from social activities.
Governor Kay Ivey ordered the flag to be lowered halfway to commemorate Lewis on Saturday and Sunday.

During the week-long memorial service, Lewis' remains will be temporarily displayed at the Alabama State Capitol in Montgomery, Georgia, the Georgia State Capitol in Atlanta, and the United States Capitol in Washington, D.C., for public mourning.
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell announced last week that people could visit the Capitol on Monday and Tuesday to pay tribute to Lewis.
Due to the coronary virus outbreak, public events to mourn Lewis will be held outdoors.
Shenzhen to open consultation on health regulation - Xinhua News website

Xinhua News Agency (Xinhua News Agency) in Shenzhen on July 26 (reporters Mao Siqian and Bai Yu) encouraged residents to take regular physical examinations, early detection of problems, prohibition of sale of alcoholic beverages to minors, establishment of an online game health examination system, employing units to equip special part-time health managers ...

In order to encourage residents to undertake regular physical examinations and to detect problems early, the above-mentioned drafts of the request for comments are submitted that the health and hygiene departments should formulate a basic catalog of health examination items according to different age, occupation and other factors.
The cost of health check-up within the basic list of health check-up items shall be paid by the social insurance fund in accordance with the standard of once a year for each person.

The Employer shall rationally allocate human resources, arrange working hours for employees, implement a system of rotational leave for employees whose mental and physical workloads are heavier, avoid excessive loss of human physical and mental energy or injury to their physical and mental health, and strictly implement a system of paid leave for employees.
In addition, employing units should be equipped with special part-time health managers and regularly organize health check-ups of employees.

With regard to the physical and mental health of minors, the draft opinion shall be submitted, prohibiting the sale of alcoholic beverages to minors, and limiting the location of sale of alcoholic beverages.Any violation of the provisions shall be ordered to be corrected by the market supervision and administration department and a fine of 30,000 yuan shall be imposed.
In addition to “prohibition,” minors should “exercise more.”
According to the request of the opinion, the school should arrange more than one hour of sports activities for the students every day.

With regard to online games, the public security, cultural, tourism, sports, network supervision, health and other departments shall improve the health supervision system of Internet-on-line service business premises, establish a system for the health examination of online games, and create a good communication space and culture for promoting the healthy growth of young people.

In addition, the petition also proposed that patients with influenza should wear masks when entering and leaving public places, and that medical and health institutions should be fined 20,000 yuan for disclosing patients' privacy without their consent.

It should be noted that in addition to the physical and mental health of residents, the request for comments also requires Shenzhen departments to evaluate the impact of public policy implementation on the health of the population before formulating planning and normative documents relating to urban spatial planning and construction, industrial park planning and construction, resource development and utilization and ecological environment protection, biomedical industry development, and approving major construction projects and implementing major public service projects.

No formulation, promulgation or approval shall be made for the implementation of measures that will have a serious adverse effect on urban public health or the health of residents without evaluation or evaluation.

Recently, during his visit to Jilin Province, the Chinese President stressed the need to strengthen the leadership of the Party, promote the extension of Party organization to the most grass-roots level, improve the working system of Party organization at the grass-roots level, and provide strong guarantees for the governance of urban and rural communities.

In the process of resolving the key difficulties in the field of grass-roots governance, we should focus on practical exercises to resolve the troubles and disturbances that the masses are concerned about, and to hammer out the Party's strength and ability.
Take up the standard upgrade and build a battle fortress.

Communist Party members should play a role in community governance by participating in thematic Party Day activities, communicating with the hard-pressed masses, identifying service projects, acknowledging the smallest wishes, and making reasonable suggestions, etc., and by participating in community construction, management and service.

The foundations of the building are solid.

Xinhua News Agency (Xinning) reported by wire on July 25 (reporter Wang Jinjin) that the monitoring showed that Tibetan antelopes that had previously migrated to the Zhongnohu area of the Cocos Territory's hinterland were gradually ending their breeding and beginning to return to their original habitats with their young.
On 25 July, about 40 female Tibetan antelopes led by three young Tibetan antelopes passed 3002 km of the Qinghai-Tibet Highway and the Qinghai-Tibet Railway Five-Beam North Bridge.
Experts analyzed that in recent years, the number of young Tibetan antelopes in the return sheep herd accounted for one-quarter to one-fifth of the total number of Tibetan antelopes.

Lian Xinming, associate researcher at the Northwest Plateau Institute of Biology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, said: "In the early stages of migration, Tibetan antelopes face a high risk of predation, so the number of pups in the flock will be relatively small, and there may even be no pups.

According to the National Park Service, the number of Tibetan antelope returns has been increasing year by year, and in 2019, the number of Tibetan antelope returns was 4,860, an increase of 338 from 2018.
"It is expected that the return of Tibetan antelopes this year will end at the beginning of September, and the number of returning Tibetan antelopes is still expected to increase," Lian said.
Tibetan antelope belongs to the national level of animal protection.
At the end of May every year, Tibetan antelopes from Qinghai's Three Rivers, Tibet's Qiangtang, and Xinjiang's Al Jinshan go to Lake Zhongno, which lies in the hinterland of Kokoxi.

"Tibetan antelope migration is the process of female antelopes returning to their homeland with their offspring after they have finished breeding," said Wu Xiaomin, an expert on the conservation of Tibetan antelopes and a researcher at the Shaanxi Provincial Zoological Institute (Northwest Endangered Animal Research Institute).

In order to ensure the safe relocation of the Tibetan antelope herd, reporters learned that the Coco Sili Management Office of the Yangtze River Source Park of the Sanjiangyuan National Park Administration has arranged staff to carry out video surveillance and patrol in the main relocation area.

If a Tibetan antelope tries to cross the highway, the mountaineering team will conduct temporary traffic control at the earliest opportunity, so that the sheep can safely pass through the wildlife passageway, ensuring that they are as little as possible disturbed by humans on the way back.
So, how in everyday life should cool down the heat?

Experts recommend that you avoid high temperatures when you go out in the summer. It is best not to walk or work in the hot sun after mid-afternoon, because the sun is the strongest and the chances of heatstroke are higher.

If you have to go out at this time, be sure to do a good job of protection, such as shading the sun umbrella, wearing a sun hat, wearing sunglasses, the best condition is to apply sunscreen to protect against sunburn.

Wear light-colored, breathable cotton, linen and silk fabrics as much as possible, and wear fewer garments of synthetic fibers, so as not to be able to dissipate heat in time when sweating profusely, causing heatstroke.

Drink plenty of water in hot and humid weather. Do not wait until you are thirsty to drink, because if you feel thirsty, it means your body is running out of water. Limit your drinking to 150 milliliters to 200 milliliters each time. Drink warm water and do not drink ice water.
Depending on the temperature, the average person drinks 1.5 to 2 liters of water per day, while high-temperature workers drink 3 to 5 liters of water per day.
When sweating more, you can properly replenish some salt water to make up for the loss of salt in the body due to sweating.
In addition, in summer, the human body is easily deprived of potassium, making people feel tired and tired, potassium-containing tea is a great summer drink.

Eat plenty of watery fruits and vegetables in summer, such as raw vegetables, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. Fresh fruits, such as peaches, apricots, cucumbers, melons, etc., with a water content of 80% to 90% can be used to replenish water; dairy products can both replenish water and satisfy the body's nutritional needs.
In addition, people working in high-temperature environments should be properly supplemented with drinks containing elements such as potassium and magnesium.
Summer days and nights are short, the temperature is high, the body metabolism is vigorous, the consumption is also large, easy to feel tired.
Sufficient sleep can relax both the brain and the body's systems, both for work and study, and as a measure to prevent heatstroke.
Experts say the best time to go to bed is between 22:00 and 23:00, and the best time to get up is between 5:30 and 6:30.
When sleeping, be careful not to lie under the air conditioner outlet and electric fan, so as not to suffer from air conditioning disease and thermal injury.

Experts suggest that people who are outdoors or engaged in high-temperature work should carry ten drops of heat-resistant medicines such as water, dandelion, herb-flavored water or herb-flavored pills with them, or place them close to the workplace and use them at all times to prevent heat strokes.
Graduate Art Exhibition Moved to Public Interest Exhibition in Shopping Mall - Official Website
In the season of "cloud graduation" in major institutions, a rare underground graduate art exhibition warmly kicks off last weekend.
However, it is neither in the gallery nor in the campus, but in the public space of Chaoyang Daetsu City, and will be open to the public free of charge until August 23.

The press learned that the 2020 Graduate Art Exhibition gathered 50 pieces/groups of works by 57 young artists from the Central Academy of Fine Arts, China Media University and Tianjin Academy of Fine Arts.The exhibition space was extended from the 2nd to the 6th floors.
The significance of this exhibition is particularly striking in the face of the epidemic.

"We have chosen to bring back the underground space of the graduation exhibition 'Cloud End' again, and hope that more people will see young people's exploration of themselves and understanding of the world, and enlarge the healing power of art for society and the mind.

She revealed that the exhibited works were collected from graduates of several art academies and selected from them to be displayed in commercial spaces.The works ranged from traditional shelving paintings and sculptures to new media installations, interactive animations and VR panoramas.

Li expressed his feelings about the epidemic through a mixture of mechanical and manual language in First Battle of 2020; Liu explored the themes of cryptocurrencies, credit creation, and transactions in Sound Money, a work created by Ethereum blockchain; Zhang Jiaqi's Catwood and Qiu Daqiang's Custody are often accompanied by animals, from which one can see a young artist's understanding of the relationship between humans and animals; and Zhu Zhongyu's Winter of Faith - Gift is a reminder to growing young people, "When one day a career succeeds, do not forget the original heart, remember that simple and sincere."
Among the few graduates who exhibited in person was Li Kei-ting from the Sculpture Department of Tianjin Academy of Fine Arts.
"I came to Beijing on July 7th, when I was a little worried about the epidemic, and I had a nitric acid test three days in advance, which was spread with alcohol cotton and the test report.
The structure of his work, Yesterday as a Riddle, is more complicated and must be done by hand.
At the same time, he undertook the task of helping students repair damaged works.
"The cloth was unfolded until 4:30 in the morning, and then repaired. It was very tight, and I forgot to take a picture with the work, and it was a bit of a pity.
He hopes that when the epidemic becomes more stable, he and his classmates will come to Beijing to see his art exhibition.

A small plane crashes in the Swiss Alps, killing all four on board - China News
On July 25 local time, Swiss police informed the media that a small plane crashed in the Swiss Alps on the 25th.
Two Swiss and two Austrians were killed on board.

Police in Wallis, southern Switzerland, reportedly stated that a small plane had crashed at an altitude of more than 3,000 metres near the Valais Alps, and rescuers arrived at the crash site to confirm that all four people on board were killed.
Wallace state police said the witness called the police at 12:25 p.m. on the 25th to report that he had seen a small plane crash from the sky.
A few minutes later, witnesses again told police that heavy smoke had erupted from the crash site.
After receiving the alarm, the police quickly coordinated firefighters, medical personnel and rescue workers and helicoptered to the scene of the accident to rescue.
When rescuers arrived at the crash site, they found that all four people on board had been killed.
Police confirmed that the victims of the accident included two Swiss, aged 50 and 66, and two Austrians, aged 46 and 50.
Police say they are currently working with the Swiss Transport Safety Investigation Commission to investigate the cause of the crash.
Heavy rains in 33 districts and counties in Chongqing issue yellow and orange flood warnings-CNN
In the past 24 hours, 33 districts and counties in Chongqing have experienced heavy rainfall, of which 16 districts and counties have experienced heavy rainfall.
The heavy rainfall caused 71 floods in Chongqing's small and medium-sized rivers, and two flood warnings were issued.
From 8 a.m. to 8 a.m. on 25–26 June, heavy rainfall occurred in most areas of Chongqing, according to the Chongqing Municipal Hydrometeorological Monitoring Station.

Thirty-three districts and counties, including Tongnan, Tongliang, and Hechuan, experienced heavy rainfall, with 16 districts and counties, including Chung, Kaizhou, and Wuxi, experiencing heavy rainfall.

Seventy-one small and medium-sized rivers such as Tongnan Fujiang, Qiangjiang, and Kaizhou Nanhe have experienced 1 to 7 meters of flooding, with the highest water level not exceeding the alert water level.
It is expected that from 8:00 a.m. on 26th to 8:00 a.m. on 27th, medium-sized and small rivers in large parts of Chongqing will experience different degrees of flooding.
At the same time, the region will also be concerned about the possible cross-border flooding of the Yangtze River and the Jialing River.
The CBA welcomes the first spectators after the replay, want to see the playoffs pay attention to these - Zhongxin net
Author: Yuechuan Editor-in-Chief: Yuechuan
According to the official CBA League news, the CBA Qingdao Stadium today finally welcomed the first group of fans to watch the game after the replay.

Fans attending the game included Qingdao mobile workers, doctors, teachers, and public security personnel who had made outstanding contributions to society during the outbreak, and the CBA playoffs officially opened on July 31, when tickets for fans would be officially resumed.
Due to the outbreak, the CBA restarted on June 20, nearly five months after the league's suspension.
Although there were not many spectators on the afternoon of the 26th, the feeling of the camp was already evident: there were applause and there were silences.

New drug to treat angioedema caused by new coronary artery at University of Australia - Official website

Researchers at Monash University in Australia are developing a new drug that could help prevent heart disease and stroke and hope to treat blood clots caused by the new crown virus, Xinhua reported in Sydney on July 26.
The researchers found that an enzyme in the platelets accelerates platelet coagulation before a heart attack or stroke.
So they developed a drug that temporarily inhibits platelet aggregation, thereby avoiding blood vessel clogging and preventing heart disease and stroke.
The drug only suppresses platelet coagulation when heart disease or stroke signs appear, the researchers said.

Since studies have shown that similar blood clots are one of the main causes of death in patients with new coronary heart disease, the researchers hope the drug will be used in the future to treat such patients.
Now that the drug has been shown to work well in animal models, the researchers are preparing for the next phase of human clinical trials.
The results have been published in the journal Science and Transformative Medicine in the United States.
