Deep Cultivation of "Sunflower Field" in Xinjiang Using Clean Energy - China New Internet
Source: China News Network Author: Chen Haifeng Editor in charge: Chen Haifeng
Xinjiang's deep-cultivated sunflower fields use clean energy, Xinjiang News Agency, July 26, 2007 (Xinjiang News Agency)

More than 6,000 five-sided sundials, each 48 square meters in size, are arranged neatly in a circle, like a silver sunflower field, which rotates with the sun, reflecting the sunlight to a central heat-absorbing tower more than 200 meters high, generating electricity.
The reporter saw the scene at the Central Electric Power Engineering Hami molten salt tower-type photothermal power plant in the town of Mu Maohu in Igo County, Hami City, Xinjiang.

"The so-called molten salt tower photo-thermal power generation is the reflection of sunlight through the mirror surface to the heat-absorbing tower to form thermal energy, and then through traditional power generation technology to convert thermal energy into electricity.

Zhang Yong, deputy general manager of CPC Hami Solar Thermal Power Co., Ltd., said the design principle is similar to the solar cooker used in rural areas of northwest China, all the sunlight will be gathered.

Construction of the power plant began in October 2017, and the network was completed by the end of last year, covering an area of 6,600 acres, with a total of 14,500 sets of sundials planned to be installed.
"Compared to conventional solar power generation, its greatest advantage is that it can store the accumulated heat and generate electricity at night.

Mr. Zhang said the 13-hour heat storage system provided by the project would allow the generators to operate continuously and stably, without being affected by changes in light, and to quickly participate in the peak adjustment of the grid according to the peak demand of the grid's load valley.

After completion, the project will generate 198 million degrees of electricity annually, save more than 60,000 tons of standard coal per year, reduce emissions of more than 60 tons of sulphur dioxide, more than 60 tons of nitrogen oxides, about 20 tons of smoke and dust, and more than 1.5 million tons of carbon dioxide, providing local clean energy sources.
In addition, there is another silver "Sunflower Field" in the Ishinomaki Photovoltaic Industrial Park in Hami City.

Over 2,300 acres of Hampshire Light's solar photovoltaic power plant, 714 generating units have been built that also follow the sun's rotation, always keeping the sun's rays at 90 degrees perpendicular to the surface of the photovoltaic panel.

"We use double-axis tracking photovoltaic power generation technology. Through integrated control, all power generation equipment can be adjusted to the angle of the sun's altitude to maintain power generation efficiency.

The power generation technology can increase the efficiency of photovoltaic generation by about 20 percent compared to conventional photovoltaics in sunny weather conditions, said Meng Qi, the station's director.
In the first half of this year, the power station has generated more than 7 million degrees of electricity, replenishing local demand for electricity.

At present, Shichengzi Photovoltaic Industrial Park is Xinjiang's largest single-unit, the most complete photovoltaic component type of a photovoltaic industry demonstration park, a total of 38 residential photovoltaic power generation projects, a total installed capacity of 820,000 kilowatts.
Electricity generated in the first half of this year exceeded 110 million degrees, an increase of 6% compared to the same period in 2019.
Hami is one of the best areas in China for solar energy.
The average annual total solar radiation is more than 6,200 megajoules per square metre, with around 3,200 hours of sunshine per year.
In recent years, the city has vigorously developed the photovoltaic industry and planted "Sunflower Fields".

Solar power generation of more than 2.5 million kilowatts has been installed, and the city's photovoltaic generation exceeded 1.4 billion degrees in the first half of this year, up about 14% year-on-year.
At present, there are more than 330 photovoltaic power plants in Xinjiang, with an installed capacity of more than 10 million kilowatts.
Photovoltaic generation is expected to reach 15 billion degrees this year, replacing more than 6 million tons of standard coal.

For various reasons, nucleic acid testing also produces false negative results.

For people who have been to high-risk areas of the epidemic, if fever and respiratory symptoms occur, a negative nucleic acid test may be false negative, so it also takes two nucleic acid tests to rule out.

Brazilian study shows that hydrochlorobenzene is ineffective in the treatment of mild-to-moderate pneumonia - CNS
Recently, a Brazilian study has shown that hydrochlorobenzene is ineffective in patients with mild to moderate pneumonia.
The study was published in the New England Journal of Medicine.

The researchers divided 667 patients from 55 hospitals across the country into three groups and conducted clinical trials comparing the efficacy of hydrochlorobenzene alone or in combination with other antibiotics, azithromycin, to see if it could improve the condition of mild and moderate patients with new coronary pneumonia.
The results showed that hydrochlorobenzene not only had no therapeutic effect, but could have harmful side effects on the organs.

The study was carried out in collaboration with the Brazilian Clinical Research Institute (BCRI) and the Brazilian Network for Critical Care Research (BRICNet) by several authoritative Brazilian hospitals such as Hospital Israelita Albert Einstein, Heart and Stroke Hospital (HCor), and Hospital Sírio-Libanês in Syria.

The four departments launched a new round of app governance to protect personal information security - Zhejiang website

Xinhua News Agency ( reporters Yu Junjie and Chen Aiping ) reported on July 25 by wire from the State Internet Agency (SINA) that the work to control the illegal collection and use of personal information by apps in 2020 has been officially launched recently, focusing on cracking down on people's strong problems such as the private uploading of personal information from behind apps.

It is reported that this round of app governance work is carried out by the four departments of the State Network Office, the Ministry of Industry and Communications, the Ministry of Public Security, and the State Administration of Market Supervision.

Last year, the special governance working group, composed of four departments, received more than 12,000 pieces of information that netizens could effectively report, conducted checks on more than 2,300 apps, and adopted punitive measures such as public exposure, negotiation, and downgrading of 260 apps that were large in size and had outstanding problems.
According to the heads of the relevant agencies, the current number of apps has exceeded 5 million, and the problem of illegally collecting and using personal information has not been solved at all.
In 2020, the governance work will be further strengthened, based on App verification, the governance scope will be further expanded to SDK (software development toolkit) and small programs, etc.

It is reported that the working group will carry out thematic research and in-depth testing on issues such as non-standard use of personal biometric information collection and sensitive permissions abuse of apps, focusing on the abuse of backstage permissions such as recording and photography.

Depending on the seriousness of the circumstances and consequences of the problem, the Working Group shall, in accordance with the law and regulations, impose punishments such as negotiation, warning, suspension, fine, etc., thus forming an effective deterrent to violations of the law and regulations.

It is understood that the working group plans to formulate and issue guidelines for the app store's audit management of the behavior of app collection and use of personal information, and to urge the app store to effectively audit the app before it goes online, and to tighten the entrance barrier.

In addition, the Task Force will also release free technical tools to guide small and medium-sized enterprises in conducting self-assessments and enhancing the legality of small and medium-sized enterprises' personal information collection and use activities.

U.S.-China Trade Representative Meets in August

The head of China's trade negotiating team, Vice Premier Liu He, and the joint leader of the US team, trade representative Lai Haizhe, are expected to hold formal talks in August to assess the implementation of the first-stage trade agreement between the two countries, the South China Morning Post quoted an anonymous person familiar with the matter as saying on Sunday.

Although China has increased its purchases of U.S. agricultural products substantially in the past few months, it still has a long way to go from what it pledged in the trade agreement, the report said, citing factors such as the outbreak of the new crop virus.
Analysts say the recent US-China closure of each other's consulates, coupled with other disputes, could undermine any progress on trade.

The first-stage trade agreement between China and the United States comes into effect one month after its signing on January 15. The agreement stipulates that a high-level trade framework group of the two sides should meet every six months.
The meeting will be "an important turning point" for both sides to assess the progress of the agreement, people familiar with the matter said.

But the man also said that if tensions between the U.S. and China led to a lack of willingness at the time, the two sides might agree to a May 8 telephone meeting between Mr. Lai and Mr. Liu, which meets the terms of the trade agreement's six-monthly meeting.
Since this year, Sino-US relations have deteriorated rapidly, with disputes over the origin of the new crown virus, trade, Hong Kong, Xinjiang, the South China Sea, and ideology among other issues.
US President Donald Trump, who boasted earlier this year of what he had achieved in the first phase of the deal, has recently changed his mind.

He told reporters at the White House on the 23rd that although China has recently purchased a record amount of corn from the United States on a daily basis and a lot of soybeans, <unk>he trade deal is not as important to me as it was when it was made<unk>?
An anonymous Beijing government adviser also believes that a new round of trade talks is unlikely to take place because of poor US-China relations.

But he revealed that China’s economic and trade partners were still meeting on the 23rd to discuss a range of issues, including how to increase imports from the US. “We’ve done our best to buy, so any additional purchases will be difficult.”

<unk>淚t is more important than ever to keep the first-stage agreement alive,<unk>?said Peng Jiening, vice-chairman of the U.S.-China National Trade Commission, and noted that China has made progress this year in further opening up financial markets to U.S. firms.
"It's better to talk than not to talk, although it might just be routine," said analyst Plenum, an independent research firm.

NASDAQ China Chief Representative Yusheng Hao: Now is the Best Time for Chinese Companies to IPO in the U.S.-Economic Watch-Specialized Financial News Website

Due to the counterfeiting incident, the U.S. market has imposed more stringent regulation on Chinese short-selling stocks, along with long-term valuation pressure, and the pressure on Chinese short-selling stocks listed in the U.S., Netease, jingjing and other Chinese short-selling stocks have recently begun to seek listing back in Hong Kong.
And recently shell, ideal car and other companies, the enthusiasm for listing in the United States rose.
Is now the best time for Chinese companies to go public in the U.S. amid the epidemic and the Chinese stock market crisis?

"As far as the recent IPOs and the companies that are going to be listed in the U.S. are concerned, the IPOs in the U.S. have essentially been unaffected. Instead, the market is very good, and even now is the best time for Chinese companies to go to the U.S. for IPOs in the past decade.
Hao Yusheng, chief representative of Nasdaq's China region, said at the "2020 Leaders of Listed Companies Summit," hosted by Snowball.

In April, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Public Company Accounting Regulatory Commission (PCAOB) issued a Statement on the Importance of Audit Quality and Regulatory Access to Audit and Other International Information – A Discussion of Current Information Access Challenges for US Listed Companies with Extensive Operations in China.

The statement said that, despite significant increases in international cooperation and coordination in recent years, U.S. regulators still face legal and practical challenges in accessing information, and that the SEC and PCAOB faced legal and practical challenges.
Moreover, in May, the Senate passed the Foreign Companies Accountability Act, requiring additional disclosure of information about foreign companies listed in the United States.
According to Hao Yu-sheng, the crisis of short-selling stocks has not affected the appetite of investors.

<unk>淚t scared everybody when it came out, and everyone was asking about the future of not being able to go public in the U.S., but then we found out that these questions weren't on the investor side, that investors might ask about them on their recent tour of the U.S. IPO, and that they might even become standardized questions, but that's not what investors see as an important factor in investing in or not investing in a Chinese company.<unk>?
I suggest that we look at the current situation as normally as possible.
Of course, this may seem like the worst case in two years, but it hasn't affected investor appetite.
So the IPO boom will continue from now until the end of this year or before the U.S. elections.
On May 9, Jinshan Yun was officially listed on Nasdaq in the U.S., becoming the first Chinese company to go to the U.S. for an IPO after the outbreak.
"The listing of Jinshan Yun gives a lot of confidence to the Chinese companies that are preparing for IPOs.
Hao Yusheng said.

In the first half of this year, a total of 20 Chinese companies went to the US for IPOs, up 17.6% from the same period a year earlier, according to a report released by Snowball on mid-term stock data for the first half of 2020; In terms of total initial capital raising, the 20 companies raised a total of $27.25 billion, up 52.4% from the same period a year earlier; In terms of the distribution of industries, the number of IPOs in the health-care sector was outstanding in the first half of this year, up 100% from the same period a year ago.

According to Mr. Hao, Chinese companies that go to the US for IPOs in the first half of this year are of high quality, and those that have a solid foundation and high-quality growth will be more attractive to investors.
In the short, medium and long term, Mr. Hao remains optimistic about the Ming Chinese company's IPO in the U.S.

"In the short term, the IPO boom in the U.S. will continue; in the medium term, Chinese companies will have more options, A-shares, Hong Kong stocks, U.S. stocks, and everyone will consider the U.S. election and the relationship between China and the U.S. as factors of market choice and timing; in the long term, everything will return to normal, market fluctuations will be cyclical, both political cycles and economic cycles, and eventually will return to normal, the stock market has always been volatile.

"There are a lot of uncertainties this year, but for high-quality companies, whether the market is good or bad, as long as they are solid and have the growth that investors can see, the other factors are relatively minor, and investors need to invest in good Chinese companies," Mr. Hao said.

On the evening of July 25, the "Dance of Life" of the National Theatre "Sound Like Summer Flowers" series concert will be simultaneously performed online as scheduled. Conductor Yang Yang and pianist Zhang Haochun will collaborate with the National Theatre Orchestra to play Rachmaninoff's Second Piano Concerto and Symphonic Dance.

At the same time, the Taipei Lake Theater of the National Grand Theatre, located in the sub-center of Beijing City, also welcomed the first live performances since the anti-epidemic campaign, with conductor Zheng Jian hand in hand with the National Grand Theatre Choir passionately singing the "Taihu Week Concert" of the military song loudly - the army brigade choir song concert.

Following the downgrading of Beijing's response level to the epidemic, in accordance with the city's epidemic prevention and control requirements and the spirit of the relevant documents of the city, the National Grand Theatre performed a concert on July 25 in accordance with the principle of "prudently opening and gradually releasing" and sold limited tickets to the general public for the first time.
"This is the first time the National Grand Theatre has sold tickets to audiences since the outbreak," said Jin Hui, Minister of the National Grand Theatre's Market Department.

In accordance with the relevant requirements of epidemic prevention and control, real-name sales and admission of 'one person, one ticket, one certificate, one yard' shall be carried out, and the sales quantity shall not exceed 30% of the seats allocated.

Subsequently, limited tickets will be sold to the public for performances and artistic activities such as the drama "Westview Chang'an," the special concert planned for the 81st Jianjun Festival, and opera films."

The concert on 25 July also continued to be broadcast live on the National Grand Theatre Classical Music Channel and several online platforms, and by 12 pm on 25 July, the concert's online broadcast had exceeded 30 million views.

That evening, the concert opened with the anticipated "La II" opening piano bell, the first in the National Theatre's "Sound Like Summer Flower" series of concerts to dedicate a piano concerto to the audience.

With his deep and sophisticated understanding, Zhang Haoxing plays the first theme of the work full of sorrow and conflict, under the direction of Yang Yang, the orchestra and piano in the undulating competition and compromise to create a continuous listening enjoyment.

After experiencing the second movement's "Silent as Water" and the third movement's "Great Carnival", more than a hundred spectators returned to the scene in the emotion of bursts of warm applause, and on-line audiences in the way of curtain and commentary expressed sincere admiration.
Afterwards, Zhang Haochun returned to the audience with a revival of Chopin's legacy "Lift C Minor Night Song".

After a brief stage adjustment, Yang Yang conducted the orchestra of the National Theatre to perform Rakhmaninov's last major orchestral work, Symphony Dance, in which the composer presented more introspective emotions and incorporated his new inspirations and memories of his past creations and homeland.
In Yang Yang's calm and subdued treatment, the work's melancholy and magnificent atmosphere is unmistakable, and the orchestra will also depict Rachmaninoff's "Final Spark" brilliantly.
The preview of the concert once again brought the audience a surprise.

Afterwards, he came to the public space on the first floor of the National Theatre, in front of the three stories nine-foot piano with Yang Yang Yang, Zhang Haochun and the National Theatre tuner began a dialogue with them from the perspective of a senior piano lover and discussed the maintenance of the piano, the music of Rachmaninoff, the musicians' normal life and preparation for the performance, etc.
That evening, at the Taihu Open-air Theatre of the National Grand Theatre, the military anthem - the military band's chorus song music will begin in a loud and audible "Don't forget the first heart".
This is the first performance since the National Grand Theatre "Taihu Week Concert" anti-epidemic.

It is reported that on August 1, conductor Zheng Jian will also continue to bring "soldiers and the motherland" with the National Grand Theatre Choir - the National Grand Theatre celebrates the 81st Founding Day of the Army Festival chorus concert, as a "sound like summer flowers" series live on the Internet, in the classical song to pay tribute to the soldiers who defend the motherland.

Over 500 people were evacuated from Chongqing due to a landslide in Chongqing's Wulong Mountains.

Xinhua news agency in Chongqing on July 26 by wire (journalists Zhou Wenchuang and Ke Gaoyang) reporters on the 26th learned from the government of Chongqing's Wulong district, the heavy rain caused the local mountain landslide and the formation of weir lake, more than 500 people urgently transferred.

Due to the continuous rainfall, since July 22, large-scale landslide deformation has occurred after the fracture of the soil margin of the Zhongtai Group landslide in Wulong District's Luxiang Village, and the landslide body fell into the Ujiang Branch along the Cang River.

On the 25th, heavy rainfall occurred in the area, and the landslide further widened, causing the village road to be interrupted and completely blocked along the Cang River, forming a dam 13 meters in front of the dam and a reservoir with a capacity of about 420,000 cubic meters of water.

According to on-site survey and monitoring, the landslide has a volume of about 1.3 million cubic meters and is still in an unstable state, with a few stones falling, the weir has overflowed the lake and there is a risk of breakwater, which poses a threat to downstream power stations and towns.
After the disaster, the local government organized the evacuation of residents along the river overnight, and urgently transferred people to safety zones.
At present, 162 households and 520 people in the danger zone have been evacuated, and the disposal of the dam is still underway.

People's Daily Commentator: Focusing on Our Own Businesses Building New Advantages for Future Development - On Learning and Implementing the Key Points of the President-in-Office at the Entrepreneurs' Symposium
Xinhua, July 25, 2007 People's Daily, July 26, 2007 Focus on your own business and build new advantages for future development
At present, the global epidemic situation and the world economic situation are still severe and complicated, and the challenges facing China's development are unprecedented.
Maintaining our strategic strength, strengthening our confidence in winning, and concentrating on doing our own thing are the keys to meeting all kinds of risk challenges.

At the recent entrepreneurs' symposium, the Chinese President stressed that in the current external environment of rising protectionism, sluggish world economy and shrinking global markets, we must concentrate our efforts to do our own thing, give full play to the advantages of the ultra-large domestic market, gradually form a new development pattern with the domestic large-scale circulation as the main body and the domestic and international dual circulation mutually promoted, upgrade the level of modernization of industrial chain supply chains, vigorously promote scientific and technological innovation, accelerate the key core technology offensive, and build new advantages for future development.
The seeker wins, the steer wins.
In the external environment of the deep development of economic globalization, markets and resources play an important role in China's rapid development.
Now, the world is undergoing profound changes under the impact of the epidemic, facing more instability and uncertainty, and economic globalization is facing headwinds and reversals.

One of the most important aspects of preparing for and working on the changes in the external environment for a longer period of time and pushing China's economy to break through the winds and make steady progress is to expand and satisfy domestic demand as a strategic base for development, to give full play to its own advantages, and to add impetus to China's economic development through the prosperity of its domestic economy and the smooth passage of the domestic cycle, thereby promoting the recovery of the world economy.
We should deeply realize that building a complete system of domestic demand is related to our country's long-term development and long-term security.

The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) has clearly stated that it is necessary to resolutely implement the strategy of expanding domestic demand in order to cope with the impact of the epidemic, to maintain the long-term and sustainable healthy development of China's economy, and to satisfy the people's growing need for a better life.
The advantage of a large economy is that it is internally recyclable.

China has the most complete and largest industrial system in the world, a strong productive capacity, a perfect supporting capacity, more than 100 million market entities, more than 170 million people with higher education or various professional skills, and an ultra-large domestic demand market formed by 1.4 billion people, including more than 400 million middle-income groups.It is in the rapid stage of a new kind of industrialization, informatization, urbanization and agricultural modernization, and the investment demand potential is huge.

Socialist basic economic systems, such as the socialist market economy system, can not only stimulate the vitality of all kinds of market entities, liberate and develop social productivity, but also promote efficiency and equitable organic unification and continuously achieve common prosperity.

We should firmly grasp the strategic basis of expanding domestic demand, make the production, distribution and circulation of all the links more reliant on the domestic market to achieve a virtuous cycle, clarify the strategic direction of supply-side structural reform, and promote a dynamic balance between aggregate supply and aggregate demand at a higher level.

We must accelerate the construction of a complete system of domestic demand, vigorously promote scientific and technological innovation and other innovations in all aspects, accelerate the advancement of strategic emerging industries such as the digital economy, intelligent manufacturing, life and health, and new materials, and form more new growth points and growth poles.
Openness brings progress, but closedness inevitably lags behind.
President Xi Jinping has repeatedly emphasized that China's open door will not be closed, only the more open the bigger.

Taking the Great Domestic Cycle as the main subject, we should not close our doors and shut down our operations, but achieve stronger and more sustainable development by exploiting the potential of domestic demand, better connecting domestic and international markets, and making better use of both domestic and international markets and resources.

At the same time, the expansion of domestic demand and the expansion of openness are not contradictory.The smoother the domestic cycle, the more favorable it is to construct a new pattern of openness, and the more favorable it is to form new advantages in participating in international cooperation and competition.

Although protectionism is on the rise internationally, we should stand on the right side of history, insist on deepening reform, expanding openness, strengthening open cooperation in the field of science and technology, promoting the construction of an open world economy, and promoting the construction of a community of human destiny.
The Chinese nation has experienced many hardships in its history, but has never been crushed. Instead, the more it is crushed, the braver it becomes.

On the way forward, with the strong leadership of the Central Committee of the Party with Comrade Xi Jinping as its core, with the remarkable advantages of the socialism with Chinese characteristics system, with the strong mobilization capability and comprehensive strength, and with the unity and struggle of the entire Party and the entire army of the people of all ethnic groups, we will surely be able to overcome all difficulties and obstacles, maintain our country's good economic and social development momentum, achieve economic and social development and smoothly start the new quest of building a socialist modernized country in an all-round manner!

APEC Trade Ministers Meeting to Accelerate Regional Economic Recovery

A video conference of APEC trade ministers was held in Kuala Lumpur on July 25, pledging to work to reduce the impact of the new outbreak on the region's economy and accelerate regional economic recovery that is resilient, sustainable and inclusive.
The meeting was hosted by Malaysia, the host of this year's APEC Leaders' Informal Meeting.

A joint statement issued after the meeting said APEC trade ministers recognized the importance of a free, open, equitable, non-discriminatory, transparent and predictable trading and investment environment for economic recovery at this challenging time.

The parties undertake to ensure that emergency measures taken to respond to the epidemic are targeted, appropriate, transparent and temporary, do not create unnecessary trade barriers and disrupt global supply chains, and comply with WTO rules.

In the statement, APEC trade ministers pledged to strengthen cooperation to facilitate the flow of essential goods and services, promote interconnectivity by enhancing supply chain flexibility, and minimize disruptions to the flow of medical supplies, food and agricultural products in response to the epidemic.

APEC trade ministers agreed on the need to discuss how to reduce non-tariff barriers to trade in essential goods and reaffirmed their commitment to facilitating the necessary cross-border movement of people without affecting measures taken to prevent the spread of the epidemic.
The Conference also issued a declaration on facilitating the flow of essential commodities.

The declaration stated that economies would ensure that their trade measures in response to the epidemic were in line with WTO rules, and pledged to take action to reduce non-tariff trade barriers and promote trade in order to facilitate the flow of goods necessary in the event of the epidemic.

Malaysia's Minister of International Trade and Industry, Azmin Ali, who chaired the meeting, said that despite the impact of the epidemic, Malaysia remains committed to making this year's APEC meeting a success and that work on a post-2020 cooperation vision for APEC is proceeding in an orderly manner.

Malaysia agreed to hold APEC-related meetings in video format, but did not rule out the possibility of organizing substantive meetings during the informal meetings of APEC leaders at the end of the year.
13 people tested positive by the Press Department of the President's Office - China News Agency
Thirteen people positively tested by the Press Department of the President's Office
The Philippine Presidential Press Office (PCOO) announced on July 25 that Minister Martin Andanar had tested negative for pneumonia on July 24.
By the afternoon of the same day, PCOO had tested positive for 13 staff members, three of whom had previously been positive, one of whom died and two were still receiving treatment.
Due to contact with an infected PCOO staff member, Andanar and 49 PCOO staff members were tested for new coronary pneumonia on 24 April.
A report released on 25 April showed that 10 of the employees tested positive.

Marvin Gatpayat, PCOO's deputy minister of administration and law, said the department's new administration building in the presidential palace was scheduled to be reopened on the day of President Duterte's fifth State of the Union address on 27 September.

On the same day, Martin Andanar assured the public that the PCOO would continue to fulfill its responsibilities to the Filipino people, ensuring timely provision of important information to the public, and strengthening contact tracing and detection to prevent further spread of the NPV virus among PCOO staff.

"French Space Exploration Agency". www.spaceexploration.com.

France will add hundreds of millions of euros to its space defense budget to develop a military force in space to guard against “unfriendly actions” by other countries in outer space, French Defence Minister François Pali said on Thursday.

Parry told the Provence newspaper on the same day that the budget for France's military space program would increase from €3.6 billion ($4.2 billion) to €4.3 billion ($5.0 billion) between 2019 and 2025.

Under the French Military Planning Act 2019–2025, approved by the French Parliament in 2018, France is expected to upgrade its existing observation and communications satellites, launch three electromagnetic reconnaissance satellites, and upgrade its space surveillance radar.
French President Emmanuel Macron announced last July that the French Air Force would establish a Space Military Command and an Air and Space Force.
Parry said she would officially announce the creation of the space force when she visited a military school in Saron, in the Provence region, later that day.
Parry says the space force is part of the Air Force and will have 500 personnel by 2025.
"Space was once thought to serve the common interests of science, and it is no longer the case," she said. "Now it is a place where nations compete for global hegemony.
Parry reiterated Macron's earlier statement that the French had no intention of launching an arms race.
"We are not engaged in an arms race, but I have a responsibility to fully understand the threats that we may face," he said.
Parry recounted the surveillance of a French-Italian military satellite in 2017.
She said the spy was a Russian satellite.
Russia denies this claim.
Parry said France would soon have a small patrol satellite capable of detecting and tracking "the moles behind those unfriendly acts".
The French media attribute France’s quest for a space force to US President Donald Trump’s request last February for the US Department of Defense to draft a space force bill.
Trump signed the Defense Authorization Act last December, approving the creation of America’s sixth-largest military, the Space Force.
Some experts worry that the U.S. moves have accelerated the pace of U.S. space militarization and may trigger a new space arms race.

Xinhua News Agency (Xinhua News Agency) reported by wire on July 26 (journalist Jia Lijun) in the Yellow River Hubbard Waterworks Authority learned that the Hubbard Waterworks Authority has been actively defusing the second flood this year for several days. As of the afternoon of July 26, the amount of upstream incoming water and outgoing reservoir water were equal, monitoring data were normal, and the flood was passing smoothly through the Wuhai section of the Inner Mongolian Yellow River.

To cope with the flooding process, from 0 a.m. on July 23 at the Huanghe Haibwan Water Conservancy Center in Wuhai City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, the reservoir level was gradually lowered, and the discharge of the reservoir flow was controlled at a rate of not more than 3,000 cubic meters per second, and the water level before the dam was reduced to 1,071 meters, releasing the reservoir capacity for flood control.
At the same time, start the sand removal scheduling application.

Over the past few days, the Huang He Hai Ba Wan Water Conservancy Hub Authority has been closely monitoring the water situation and development changes during the flood season 24 hours a day, strengthening the operation of the reservoir and dam safety management, strengthening the inspection and protection work around the banks of the reservoir and important parts, especially hazardous work sections, to ensure flood safety.

As of 17:00 on 26 July, the Hub Bay Waterworks had an inflow rate of 2,760 cubic metres per second, an outflow rate of 2,760 cubic metres per second and a water level of 1071.5 metres in front of the dam.

At present, hydraulic structures such as the floodgate dam section, the earth and stone dam section and the tailings slope are normal, monitoring data fluctuate within the normal range, and the Yellow River's second flood this year is passing smoothly through the Wuhai section of Inner Mongolia.

CCTV News: Aiming at the follow-up difficulties encountered by migrants in integrating into local life, Ankang Langao County, Shaanxi Province, has built a "good-neighbourly home" based on local innovations, guiding the villagers to move to become citizens, achieving stability, rapid integration and prosperity.

Qiao Changjiang, 39, moved from Zhongwu Village in Yanmen Town in Langao County to the Mingzhu community in Democracy Town.
He took his old-age insurance card to the community’s “good-neighborhood home,” where he completed his old-age insurance this year in less than two minutes.

Shared Accommodation Market Rebounds in March, Report Says - Xinhua News Agency

The China Shared Accommodation Development Report 2020 (hereinafter referred to as the Report) released by the Research Center for Sharing Economics of the National Information Centre (NICC) in Beijing today shows that the share of transactions in China's shared accommodation market fell 72.1% year-on-year in the first five months of 2020 due to the impact of the epidemic.
However, the share accommodation market has been warming since March, with market volumes, orders and visitors gradually recovering.

According to the report, the share accommodation market deals fell sharply, partly due to a sharp decline in demand for travel accommodation under epidemic prevention and control, a sharp decline in order volume, a 65 per cent decline in total orders for the previous five months and a 63 per cent decline in the number of guests received.On the other hand, weak demand also led to a relatively sharp decline in overnight prices, with the average overnight price for the previous five months falling by 16 per cent year on year.

However, in March, April and May, market volumes increased by 78 per cent, 99 per cent and 35 per cent respectively, orders increased by 141 per cent, 152 per cent and 50 per cent respectively, and patronage rose by 81 per cent, 112 per cent and 28 per cent respectively.
The report noted that the development of the shared accommodation industry has been promising for a long time, but there are still many uncertainties in the recent past.

In response, Yu Fengxia, deputy director of the Center for Sharing Economic Research of the National Information Center, told the Workers' Daily that the development of shared accommodation requires stronger policy support.On the one hand, it is necessary to implement the policies already adopted in advance, further strengthen the policy coherence and focus on creating a better business environment; on the other hand, it is necessary to further stimulate consumption demand, enrich the supply of tourist accommodation services, innovative service modes and strengthen the government's cooperation with platform enterprises, and further increase the policy guidance and support.

Xiamen, July 26 (Jijiang Fushan, Zhang Shushan, Xu Jingzhen) - China's famous angiology center, Shanghai Changhai Hospital Angiology of Naval Medical University, signed an agreement with Xiamen University affiliated Zhongshan Hospital Angiology on July 25 to jointly establish a collaborative center to promote exchange and cooperation in the field of angiology, especially acute aortic disease.

Zhongshan Hospital, affiliated with Xia University, said that after the two hospitals' vascular surgeries formally form a collaborative unit, they will conduct remote consultations, formulate treatment plans with Changhai Hospital in real-time online consultations, select talents for further training, and jointly carry out weekly surgical technology exchange, teaching check-ups, and so on.For complicated cases, Changhai experts can be invited to the hospital to perform operations according to patients' needs, thereby realizing that patients in southwest Minnan can enjoy the best medical resources in the country without going to the province.
The two hospitals will also work together to carry out innovative surgical research, aortic diseases and early screening, etc.
The Aortic Seminar, sponsored by the Beijing Health Promotion Association and sponsored by Zhongshan Hospital of Xiamen University, was held in Xiamen on the same day.

The signing ceremony of the Angio-surgical Collaboration Centre was held at the same time by the two renowned hospitals in Shanghai and Xiamen to announce the establishment of a collaborative unit to jointly improve the treatment of angio-surgical-related diseases in the southwest of Fujian.

Shanghai Changhai Hospital Vascular Surgery is the only Institute of Vascular Surgery in the army and the only clinical medical center of vascular system diseases in Shanghai. It is also the first major department of vascular surgery in the country.
Professor Huang Xiaojin, Director of Vascular Surgery at Zhongshan Hospital, Xiamen University, was interviewed by the media.

The Department of Cardiovascular Surgery, affiliated with the University of Xi'an Zhongshan Hospital, is the first independent department of cardiovascular surgery in Fujian Province, and has long been dedicated to the diagnosis and treatment of aortic and peripheral vascular diseases.
In the treatment of aortic diseases, besides the treatment of interlayered aneurysms and aortic aneurysms, we have extensive experience in the diagnosis of ruptured aortic aneurysms.

"The history of vascular surgery at Xiamen University's Sun Yat-sen Hospital, the scope, difficulty and complexity of operations, and so many other aspects are very outstanding in this region, so this time we have established a collaborative center, in addition to the aorta, we can also carry out in-depth cooperation in all aspects of medicine, teaching and scientific research in the diagnosis and treatment of diseases such as lower extremity and cervical arteries," he said.
Professor Feng Rui, deputy director of vascular surgery at Shanghai Changhai Hospital, said.
Xiamen University's Sun Yat-sen Hospital and Shanghai Changhai Hospital signed a contract in 2018 to establish a digestive medicine "Li Zhaoxing Famous Medical Studio".

Professor Huang Xiaojin, director of the department of vascular surgery, told reporters on CNN that the department of vascular surgery and Changhai Hospital have a long history of exchange. The two hospitals have now formally formed a collaborative unit, enabling the two sides to cooperate and exchange on a new level.

He said the institute would regularly invite Shanghai experts to Xiamen to conduct exchanges of surgical techniques, conduct classroom visits, discuss cases of suspected diseases and so on.At the same time, the institute would further develop remote consultations, which are currently planned to be held once a week.

At the meeting, the reporters learned that vascular disease is the leading cause of death in China, and the aorta as the main artery of all organs of the human body, from the heart to the whole body, plays an important role.

The aortic disease is often associated with high risk, high mortality, and difficulty in treatment. The thickest section of the aorta, up to 4 cm in diameter, is at high risk of bleeding if an aneurysm develops and ruptures, or if an endothelial rupture creates a septum.

In recent years, as people's lifestyles change and the pace of life accelerates, China has become the world's largest country for high blood pressure, and aortic diseases have increased accordingly. Nowadays, with the development of surgical technology and industrial materials, the treatment of aortic diseases is continuously developing in the direction of minimally invasive, rapid and efficient.

Doctors can achieve good therapeutic results by inserting a stent from the thigh into the aorta to "transform" the blood flow, thus avoiding the impact of an aneurysm or ruptured septum, and in some operations even requiring local anesthesia.

This academic seminar invited more than ten domestic experts to discuss new advances in the treatment of aortic diseases, and conducted advanced technology training and discussion of suspected cases in the form of conference salon.

At the meeting, the reporters learned that with the development of surgical technology and industrial materials, the treatment of aortic diseases is continuously developing in the direction of minimally invasive, rapid and efficient.

The longest high-speed railway tunnel in the Three Gorges Reservoir Area - China New Railway Network
Author: Chen Haifeng Editor-in-Chief: Chen Haifeng
The picture shows the construction site of the Little Three Gorges Tunnel.
China Railways Chengdu Branch Group Co., Ltd.
China Railways Chengdu Bureau Group Co., Ltd. reported on July 26 that the 13.9-kilometer-long Zheng Wan High-Speed Railway's Little Three Gorges Tunnel would pass through the city on the same day.

It is understood that the Little Three Gorges Tunnel is not only the longest high-speed tunnel in the Three Gorges Reservoir Area, but also the longest single-hole double-track high-speed tunnel designed to reach 350 km/h in the projects currently under construction in China.

Zheng Wan high-speed railway is located in Henan, Hubei, and Chongqing three provinces, in Zhengzhou north to Beijing Guangdong, Xu Lan high-speed railway, in Wanzhou south to Yuan Wan high-speed railway arrives in Chongqing, is an important part of China's "eight-column eight-sided" high-speed railway network along the river channel and Hunan channel.
The entire route of the Zheng Wan high-speed railway passes through the Little Three Gorges Tunnel on the 26th.
The graph shows the permeation of the site.

Zheng Wan high-speed railway starts in Zhengzhou City, Henan Province, and runs southwest through Pingding City, Nanyang City, Xiangyang City, Hubei Province to Wanzhou District, Chongqing City, with a total length of about 818 kilometers, a design speed of 350 kilometers per hour, and about 184 kilometers within Chongqing.
The Zhengzhou to Xiangyang section was opened on December 1, 2019, and the Chongqing section is accelerating construction.
The project is located at the junction of Fengjie County and Wushan County, Chongqing City, and is about 18.9 kilometers long and 890 meters deep.
Construction of the tunnel began in February 2017 and the entire line was completed on 26 July 2020.

According to Wang Guojun, the head of the design department of Zheng Wan High-speed Railway Tunnel, China Central Railway Secondary School Engineering Group Co., Ltd., the geological conditions of the Xiao Three Gorges Tunnel are very complicated, and it faces risks such as lava flow, mudslides, soft rock large deformation, and belongs to the I-class high-risk tunnel, the tunnel design and construction are very difficult.

"During the construction of the project, we used geological surveying, physical exploration and advanced drilling methods to make advanced geological forecasts, and adopted special design schemes for more than 30 different types of holes. For example, we designed and constructed a bridge 24 meters long and a large hole with a longitudinal length of more than 10 meters and a depth of more than 55 meters across the tunnel to prevent the tunnel from sinking," Wang said.

According to the construction party, the Central Railway Tunnel Bureau, the tunnel construction, adopted a combination of evacuation and blockade, through the construction of horizontal tunnel flat guide, slurry blockade, strengthening the tunnel structure support and construction of sewage treatment station, not only ensured the orderly advancement of the project, but also avoided the construction drainage to the water body of the Small Three Gorges scenic area, while successfully overcoming the bad geology such as the large deformation of soft rock for 7 kilometers, the multi-tipped mud flooding with the maximum daily flow of 15.7 million cubic meters.

After the completion and opening of the Zheng Wan high-speed railway, it will become a new convenient and fast main passenger corridor to the Central Plains, North China and Northeast China in the southwest of China.It is of great significance to improve the capacity and quality of the railway corridor from the southwest to the northeast of China, improve the layout of the regional road network, accelerate the development of tourism resources and urbanization along the line, promote regional coordination and development, and promote the implementation of the strategy of large-scale development in the west.
Experts say gathering immigration data through the U.S. Census to allocate seats in the House of Representatives is unconstitutional

Some civil rights groups and several US cities and counties have filed lawsuits against the US federal government, claiming that the Trump administration's attempts to exclude undocumented immigrants from the US census are both unconstitutional and impractical.
The United States Census will determine the distribution of seats in the United States House of Representatives.
"It's not going to work," Sarah Brannon, executive attorney for the American Civil Rights League, told VOA.
She went on to say that Trump's demands for a census to determine the citizenship of the census takers were difficult to achieve and "not very reliable."
Another civil-rights group, Common cause, filed a lawsuit Thursday challenging Trump’s executive order.
Several cities in New Jersey and Georgia joined the lawsuit.
Arlington County, Virginia, joined the suit Friday.

"The U.S. Constitution requires us to accurately count our population every 10 years, and we must accurately count everyone who lives in Arlington County," said Gary Garvey, chairman of Arlington County's board of directors.
Other organizations and individuals have praised President Trump’s executive orders.
Alabama Attorney General Marshall called the executive order a "victory" for the state.

"The allocation of seats in the House of Representatives and electoral districts in each state must be based on the number of residents residing in the states and the number of residents legally resident," he said.
The US Supreme Court last year prevented the Trump administration from including citizenship in the 2020 census.

President Donald Trump signed an executive order earlier this week directing U.S. Census Bureau Trade Secretary Robert Ross to submit census data on undocumented populations so that the administration can exclude them from state census figures, thereby determining whether each state increases or decreases or maintains seats in the House of Representatives.
Every 10 years, the United States redistributes seats in the House of Representatives according to demographic changes.

Tunisian President Nominates New Prime Minister
Tunisia's presidential palace announced on July 25 that President Said had nominated the caretaker interior minister, Hisham al-Mahdi, as the new prime minister, Xinhua reported.
The announcement said that according to the constitution, Mikheil Saakashvili should complete his cabinet within a month and submit the list of the new government to parliament for approval.
The composition of the new government must be supported by more than half of the 217 members of parliament.
Born in 1974, he holds a master's degree in law and management and was appointed Minister of the Interior in February this year.
On 15 July, the then Prime Minister of Tunisia, Rafik Hariri, announced his resignation and was approved by the President.
Previously, Tunisia's largest parliamentary party, the Baath Party, had announced its withdrawal of support for the Fah Fah government, leaving it with insufficient parliamentary support.
Employment and Prices Overall Steady Show "Temperature" in the Economy - China News Agency
Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief Responsibility Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief
Employment and Prices Overall Steady Show "Temperature" in the Economy
China Economic Daily, China Economic Network.

In the first half of this year, faced with the impact of the epidemic of pneumonia, China has coordinated efforts to promote epidemic prevention and control and economic and social development, the epidemic prevention and control situation has been steadily improving, the steady recovery of the economy is evident, employment and prices, which are closely related to people's livelihoods, have been generally stable, and the Chinese economy has submitted a warm economic performance report.
The survey unemployment rate rose in the first two months of this year.

In particular, in February, many enterprises' production and operation activities were essentially suspended, demand for workers decreased, recruitment was delayed or cancelled, and the unemployment rate in urban surveys rose.
With the gradual improvement of the epidemic prevention and control situation, the order of production and life of the whole society is continuously restored.

The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) insists on the overall basic tone of its efforts to secure steady progress, further intensifies macroeconomic policy countermeasures, strengthens employment priority policies in an all-round manner, and actively promotes the work of supporting enterprises to secure and expand employment.

China has stepped up its policy to hedge against job insecurity, launched a policy mix of "deductions, exemptions and repayments," phased-in deductions and exemptions from the payment of three social insurance units, allowed delays in the payment of social insurance contributions, expanded the return of unemployment insurance to small and medium-sized enterprises on a steady basis, benefited from the worker-on-the-job training policy, and granted subsidies and apprenticeship subsidies to enterprises to absorb the employment of key groups.

With the implementation of various employment stabilization policies, the demand for workers by enterprises steadily increased, the employment situation gradually improved, and the urban unemployment survey rate gradually fell, and in June, the survey unemployment rate was 5.7%.

Zhang Yi, director of the Population and Employment Statistics Division of the National Bureau of Statistics, said that in the second quarter, various employment policies continued to be effective, and the labor force that had withdrawn due to the epidemic in the previous quarter was gradually returning, and the labour participation rate in urban areas rose by about 10 percentage points in June compared with February, close to the level of the same period of the previous year.

The figures show that the total number of jobs in urban areas rose more than 19% in June compared to February, with most industries reaching the pre-epidemic level.The average weekly working hours of enterprise employees reached 46.8 hours, up 6.6 hours from February and slightly more than 0.1 hours from January.
Prices also affect thousands of households.
In January, the CPI rose 5.4 per cent year-on-year, the highest it has seen in years.
In February, year-on-year growth in the CPI remained in the “five-zone” despite a slight decline.
The year-on-year increase in CPI was at a high level, driven not only by consumer demand before the Spring Festival, but also by the wrong month and lower year-on-year base figures.
However, the effect of pneumonia epidemic on prices is particularly pronounced.
Due to the prevention and control of the epidemic, delays in logistics, inadequate supply of materials and increased transportation costs were observed throughout the country in January and February.

In order to cope with the disturbance caused by the epidemic prevention and control to the price situation, the relevant departments have included important living materials in the scope of emergency transportation protection to ensure the smooth transportation of materials.
Under the influence of a series of policy measures, the supply of vegetables and fruits in the market is strongly guaranteed.

To cope with the rapid rise in pigmeat prices at the beginning of this year, the central government has introduced a policy of price stability in supply and demand, which has been implemented rapidly by all regions and departments, and the supply of pigmeat has been significantly improved, pig production capacity has been restored in an orderly manner, and the order of production and sale has gradually become normal.

Since March, the price of pork has been falling steadily, leading to a year-on-year increase in food prices of 10.6% in May.In June, the price of pork has risen slightly due to the slowdown in the production of piglets, a reduction in imports and a rise in demand for group consumption.
The seasonal variation in the price of fresh vegetables was evident, with an average increase of 3.4 per cent in the first half.
Fresh fruit prices continued to fall year-on-year, falling 13.3% on average in the first half of the year, due to higher base figures compared to the same period last year.
The basic life of the masses is effectively guaranteed and the general economic and social situation remains stable and orderly.
With the gradual resumption of transportation logistics, the strengthening of supply and demand insurance in various places, the market supply and demand situation improved.
At the start of March, the CPI fell for four consecutive months, and year-on-year growth fell from 4.3 per cent in March to 2.5 per cent in June.

In the second half of the year, China's prices will continue to remain moderate, and overall inflationary pressure will be moderate.However, we still need to restore the order of production and life on the premise that epidemic prevention and control are normalized.

We will respond effectively to natural disasters such as flooding and drought in the main producing areas of agricultural products such as grains, fruits and vegetables, strengthen market supervision, and resolutely combat acts that disturb market order such as hoarding and extortion of prices.

All Departments Actively Implement Flood Control Measures to Ensure Transportation Safety-CNN News
China has been hit by heavy rainfall in many places since the beginning of the summer, Xinhua news agency reported by wire in Beijing on July 26.

In order to do a good job of flood prevention and transportation safety, all departments will stick to their posts, strengthen the detection and control of hidden dangers, intensify emergency disposal, and implement flood prevention measures in a comprehensive manner.

According to the latest statistics from China National Railway Group Co., Ltd., the railway department has deployed more than 280,000 inspectors, inspected more than 90,000 bridges, more than 17,000 tunnels and more than 240,000 culverts.

Since July 1, the main trunk lines and freight corridors of the national railways have been kept safe and smooth, and the overall transport order has been good, with passenger trains starting, running and arriving at the right points through the railway bureaus at 97.7%, 87.1% and 86.8%, respectively.

China Railway Nanchang Bureau Group Co., Ltd. has intensified emergency management through dispatch, and has appointed specialists to be responsible for dynamically tracking and mastering the situation of flood control equipment, road material reserves and storage, promptly communicating information in the event of sudden disaster failures, and initiating emergency response.

Recently, in the face of the security threat posed by heavy rainfall resulting in the formation of weir lake on the upper reaches of Yi Wan Railway Qingjiang Bridge, China Railway Wuhan Bureau Group Co., Ltd. Yichang Comprehensive Maintenance Section organized professional technicians to monitor the Qingjiang Bridge 24 hours a day, and established all-weather communication mechanism with local emergency departments to grasp and deal with risks in a timely manner.

In order to ensure the safety of electricity used in summer transportation, the Qingdao Power Supply Co., Ltd. of the Qingdao City-Meijiang District, in close cooperation with the local meteorological and railway departments, in combination with the climatic characteristics of the flood season, has strengthened inspection of railway power supply lines and facilities and investigation of hidden dangers in the areas under its jurisdiction, and has strengthened emergency management of related accidents such as landslides, collapses and mudslides in the line corridors.

To further improve flood prevention and control, Dongfang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. has set up a contingency preparedness team, conducted flood prevention and disaster knowledge training, and formulated flight plans according to the daily weather and typhoon warning, etc., and prepared for the operation and recovery of aircraft parked in coastal areas and related contingency plans.

The Death of the Salesman is a representative work of the well-known writer Arthur Miller, and has been widely acclaimed worldwide since its completion in 1949.
In the 1980s, Arthur Miller came to China with the good offices of Ying-Ying and others to rehearse his work for the Beijing People's Artists.

The screenplay was read by a group of young Beijing talented actors, who conducted two weeks of rehearsals under the direction of director Ye Tang. Each of them wrote a short biography of the characters in order to analyze them in depth, with the aim of revisiting them nearly 40 years later, so that this realistic drama masterpiece could be revitalized.

The price of the proposed shares shall not be less than the higher of: the arithmetic average of the daily weighted average price on the 30 trading days preceding the date of the notice (27 July 2020); and the net asset value per share of the company audited in the most recent accounting year.The price of the proposed shares shall not be less than the higher of: the arithmetic average of the daily weighted average price on the 30 trading days preceding the date of the notice (27 July 2020).

At present, there is no consensus on the new strategic investors for Greenland, and according to the estimates in the announcement, the new strategic investors will need to pay about 14 billion yuan for the 17.5% of the shares transferred in the greenland restructuring.

It is noteworthy that after the transfer of shares, it is expected that Greenland will still have no controlling shareholders and actual controllers, but the control structure may change significantly.

Since its inception, Greenfield Holding has undergone a number of institutional reforms: from 1992 to 1997, it operated under a purely state-owned system in accordance with the rules of marketization; from 1997 to 2013, it established and continuously improved the shareholding system of state-owned holding and employee-owned shares; from 2013 to 2015, it introduced strategic investors, forming a mixed ownership system of cross-ownership of state-owned and non-public capital and merging with each other; from 2015 to date, it has been listed as a public company as a whole.

Three-year-old school playground was smashed. Is it reasonable to sue the school after receiving the compensation?
Wang Sishou Responsibility Editor: Wang Sishou Source: Legal Daily Author: Wang Sishou
The playground was smashed and the children appealed to the school after receiving compensation
Zhao Yifan, correspondent of this newspaper
Three-year-old Xiao Wen was playing on a college playground when he was hit in the head by a baseball pitcher named Chen Sung.
As a result of the court's decision, the school's board of directors ordered the school to pay $20,000 in damages, and the school's board of trustees ordered the school to pay $20,000 in damages.

Recently, the Haidian District People's Court in Beijing dismissed the plaintiff's lawsuit on the grounds that the school had set up a safety net on the playground at the time of the incident and had fulfilled its duty to provide adequate security, and that Chen had made compensation.
Mr. Wen alleged that during the summer vacation of 2019, he played with Mr. Wen at the school playground while the baseball team was training on the playground.
In order to avoid the risks involved, Mr. Wen, Mr. Wen and many other children and parents are allowed to play in the safe areas designated by the baseball team.
But then the baseball player Chen Sung took off his hand while pitching, causing the baseball to fly over the net into the above-mentioned safety zone and hit Xiao Wen's back brain.
Mr. Wen immediately took Xiao Wen to the hospital for treatment, was diagnosed as a head injury.
Mr Wen believes that the facilities of the school playground do not comply with the relevant safety regulations and do not manage the teams and related facilities effectively.

The school's negligence led to the above-mentioned incidents, which resulted in great pain for Xiao Wen, both physically and mentally, and also brought great pain to his family, and the school should bear legal responsibility for this.

In response, the school argued that the school had set up a safety net at the playground, posted management regulations and training notices, told children to keep a safe distance from the playground and reminded them of their own safety, and that the plaintiff could not prove that the school "did not meet its obligation to ensure safety" and therefore did not agree to compensation.

The court held that the place where the incident occurred was a place open to the public free of charge by the university in question, and that although the school had an obligation to safeguard the management of the playground, such an obligation could only be fulfilled by meeting the general duty of care.

At the time of the incident, the school had set up a safety net on the playground, and had done its utmost to ensure proper safety, and Chen Shang also compensated Xiao Wen for medical expenses, transportation costs and other losses of more than 2,000 yuan in accordance with the previous compensation agreement, the two sides agreed to settle the dispute once and for all.
After the incident, Xiao Wen's parents again claimed the school's compensation, and the court ruled that the plaintiff's appeal was dismissed.
Neither side appealed the verdict, which is now in effect.

According to Article 37 of the tort liability law of our country, a school, as the manager of a public place, has the obligation of security; in the event that the act of a third party causes damage to others, the third party bears the tort liability, and the manager of a public place who has not fulfilled the obligation of security shall bear the corresponding supplementary liability.

The judge said that since as the manager of a public place, it is most likely to know the actual situation of the whole place, foresee the risks and damages that may occur, thus it is most likely to take the necessary measures to prevent the occurrence of losses or mitigate the extent of damages, and the cost of avoiding and mitigating the occurrence of damages is the lowest, so the law stipulates that it undertakes the corresponding guarantee obligation to engage in social activities.

In the present case, the school's obligation to ensure the safety of the unspecified entrants to the playground, which is open to the public free of charge, should be commensurate with the social activities it engages in. Specifically, it should mainly take basic safety measures and have an obligation to inform the public of the hidden dangers.
In the judicial practice, it is also not advisable to impose excessive safety guarantee obligations on the managers of public places.
If the school has already established a safety net and has done its duty to inform, it can be determined that the school has no fault and should not be held legally liable.

Furthermore, in the event of infringement by a third party, even if the manager of a public place, such as a school, fails to fulfil his obligation to ensure safety, his liability is supplemented by compensation for damages.
Therefore, in such accidents, the victim should not extend the scope of claims after having received compensation from the directly infringing party.

Yang Hung-nian, founder of Beijing Love Choir, passed away at the age of 86 - China News

Yang Hung-nian, founder of the Beijing Philharmonic Choir, a renowned Chinese conductor, music educator, lifelong academic member of the Central Academy of Music and professor of the Department of Conducting, passed away at the age of 86 on July 26, 2020 in Beijing at 13:55.
The picture is from the official website of the Beijing Philharmonic Choir.
Yang Hong was born in 1934 in Nanjing, Jiangsu, and has loved music since childhood.
In 1951, he entered the Department of Music of Shanghai Eastern Normal University, where he studied composition and repertoire under Professor Yang Jia Ren and German conductor Hezmann.
In 1958 he was appointed to the Department of Music of Beijing Normal Academy of Arts, and in 1973 he was transferred to the Department of Composition and Conducting of the Central Academy of Music.
Yang Hong founded the Beijing Love Choir in 1983.
For more than thirty years, he has led the choir around the world in the pursuit of love and dedication, and has won dozens of awards in important competitions at home and abroad.
He has conducted more than thirty orchestras, including the Central Choir, the Central National Choir, the Oriental Choir and the Shanghai Choir, and has conducted many symphonic and choral concerts.

His writings include "The Training of the Band", "The Training of the Choir", "The Writing of Two Songs", "The Children's Song Collection" and "The Problem of the Accuracy of the Choir", "The Acoustic Hierarchy of Orchestral Music", as well as translations of "The Method of Choir Arrangement" and "The Acoustic Language of Debussy".

"The scales are black, and the inside is black when they are cut open.

Li Dae-guo also turned from fishermen to fishermen and became a member of the patrol team to protect aquatic resources.
Since January 1, 2020, the Chongqing Aquatic Biosphere Reserve and related waters of the main city have been completely prohibited from fishing.

Israel Strengthens Prevention and Control of Repeated Outbreaks-CNN News
Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief Wang Sishou Editor-in-Chief
Israel Strengthens Repeated Epidemic Prevention and Control
In the early stages of the outbreak, Israel's preventive and control measures were effective.

However, with the gradual lifting of control measures, the number of new cases of pneumonia diagnosed in Israel has risen markedly in the recent past, and the Israeli Government has taken emergency measures to strengthen the control of the epidemic on several occasions.

On 28 February, the first case of new coronary pneumonia was diagnosed in Israel, prompting the closure of all ports of entry and exit, suspension of unnecessary industries, switching of schools to online classes, restrictions on public transport and unnecessary social activities, blockade of cities with serious epidemics, and joint military-police efforts to maintain control and prevention.
The series of measures quickly proved to be successful, and by mid-May, the number of new cases of new coronary pneumonia diagnosed in Israel had dropped to one in a single day.
As the epidemic was brought under control, Israel's preventive and control measures were completely lifted, and since June the number of new confirmed cases of pneumonia had gradually rebounded.
Especially after July, the spread of the epidemic has been accelerating.
More than 1,500 new cases a day have been reported in Israel over the past eight days, with 916 new cases reported on the same day as of the publication of the report on July 25.
As of 25 July, there were 59745 confirmed cases and 448 deaths in Israel.
Faced with the rapid rebound of the epidemic, the Israeli government has repeatedly taken emergency measures to strengthen the prevention and control of the epidemic.

On July 6, after the number of confirmed cases exceeded 30,000, the Israeli government closed gyms, swimming pools, bars, nightclubs, and other public places of entertainment, and imposed restrictions on public transportation, requiring no more than 20 passengers per bus.

On the 17th, the government announced a series of new restrictions, including the introduction of a curfew on weekends, stipulating that curfews would be imposed between 5 p.m. and 5 a.m. on Fridays and Sundays.

During this period, shops, malls, barbershops, beauty salons, libraries, zoos, museums, galleries, swimming pools and tourist attractions will be closed, while basic services such as supermarkets and pharmacies will remain open.

At the same time, meetings of more than 10 people will be prohibited on all dates and times, gyms, studios, etc. will be closed, restaurants and cafes will be closed to patrons, and only out-of-pocket services will be permitted.

At the same time, the Israeli people have not paid sufficient attention to the seriousness of the epidemic and have not been able to form a coalition with the government in the fight against the epidemic.
After repeated outbreaks of the disease in Israel, many people took to the streets to protest the government's control measures affecting their own economic interests.
On 11 July, tens of thousands of people demonstrated in Tel Aviv, claiming that anti-epidemic policies were affecting the economy.

On the evening of the 21st, thousands of protesters gathered in front of Netanyahu's official residence in Jerusalem, protesting against Netanyahu's ban on restaurants, cafeterias, and other restrictive measures without compensation.

In addition, many people do not wear a mask while outdoor activities, maintain two meters of safe social distance, and to avoid being fined by police for not wearing a mask, many people wear a mask only on the chin or hanging on the wrist.

During the recurrence of the epidemic, the school is a severe disaster area for the spread of the new crown virus, and according to a recent visit to the kindergarten, teachers and students in the kindergarten did not wear masks as required by the government, nor maintain two meters of safe social distance between each other, for a large number of teachers and students infected with the virus hidden dangers.

Professor Eli Waxman, a member of the National Security Council's expert advisory group on combating the epidemic, believes that Israel is heading towards a "dangerous situation", pointing out that Israel's current epidemic prevention and control measures are not sufficient and that all recreational and entertainment venues and summer schools should be closed in order to control the epidemic's further spread.

Mr. Waxman said Israel lacks a comprehensive plan to combat the epidemic, and that parliament and government departments should abandon their interests as soon as possible and agree on clear steps to combat the epidemic, including restrictions on different sectors.
The newspaper's correspondent in Tel Aviv, Wang Jiang, said by wire in Tel Aviv on July 25

China's Anti-Epidemic Efforts Praised in the Journal of Willow Blades-Chinanews.net

As a country with a population of 1.4 billion and a size similar to that of Europe or the United States, China has effectively controlled the outbreak of the new crown disease at this stage and has largely contained the country's epidemic without a large-scale outbreak, Liu Yedao said in a 25th-day issue of Liu Yedao magazine.

China has invested heavily in domestic research and public health over the past decade, making it much better prepared for new crowns than it was for severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), the article said.
At the time of the SARS outbreak in 2002, China was initially underprepared, especially for the uncertainty of the pathogen, the authors said.

When the new crown virus was discovered in December 2019, Chinese scientists were quickly able to identify the virus species and shared genome sequencing data with the international community on January 11, 2020.

By the end of January, doctors from mainland China and Hong Kong had elucidated the clinical characteristics of the virus and warned the world of the threat of the new crown virus by publishing a study in The Lancet.

China has also been at the forefront of vaccine research, which has been conducted very quickly and rigorously through close cooperation within the country in times of state-declared emergency, and the results of early trials of a new crown vaccine developed in China were published in May and July, respectively, in The Lancet.
China's experience shows that it is very important to invest in the national health and research system and effectively improve laboratory capacity.
This is the basis for a rapid and effective national response to health emergencies and global health security.
Other countries, especially low- and middle-income countries, are worth learning from.

Moreover, China’s experience has shown that, on the basis of strong research, strong high-level decision-makers must be decisive in making the right decisions based on scientific evidence, so that the new crop epidemic can be effectively controlled.
The article emphasizes that governments and their leaders must respect science, understand its value, and act on it in ways that are most beneficial to society.

In the early stages of the outbreak, the China National Defense and Construction Commission dispatched three groups of infectious disease experts to Wuhan to investigate the risks and spread of the new crown virus.Their recommendations provided the basis for the decision to seal off Wuhan on January 23.When experts suggested the necessity and urgency of building a square-cell hospital, the government quickly made a decision and implemented it quickly.
Finally, the article emphasizes that in response to global health emergencies, countries need to strengthen global cooperation and jointly respond.
