Batong Zhongkang sentry post, platoon Chang Yuwang and a soldier on duty station.

In a place where the average annual temperature is less than ten degrees, a row of simple barracks stands at the mouth of the mountain. Not far from the barracks, a flag flutters in the breeze, and soldiers are on duty in the wind every day, while regularly patrolling higher altitudes.
The soldiers climbed the steep slopes of the quarries, using their hands and feet.
At the end of July, the low-lying areas were full of flowers and plants, while in Batong Zhongkang, only the trenches behind the camp were relatively dense in green.

Gao Peng, a soldier who had been stationed at the sentry post for six years, pointed to the ditch and said that this was their back garden. It was only in July and August each year that the grass grew slowly, and soon afterwards it turned yellow and covered with snow.
Hiking can take up to nine hours.
Under harsh plateau conditions, the soldiers stationed here are often accompanied by snowy mountains and glaciers, and they also regularly patrol higher altitudes.
Yesterday, a patrol of eight soldiers, led by instructor Liang Yixian, once again went on patrol.
Each soldier weighs about 30 kg and heads for the target early in the morning.
A soldier was on the way, and his comrades rushed to rescue him.
In addition to their patrol duties, the soldiers at the Bagucheon sentry station undergo tactical and physical training on a daily basis.
One minute at a time, rising altitudes, decreasing oxygen levels, and overexertion test the will of the patrol.
They persisted in biting their teeth, successively crossed several landslides, crossed several hurricane-prone beaches.

At 4:00 p.m., it was lunch time for the patrols. They took out their dried food and sat on the ground at an altitude of over 5,700 meters, accompanied by rain and snow, to replenish their strength with food.
Tactical and physical training was conducted by the soldiers of the Bagucheon sentry post.
During the break, they would play cards together, and the losers would have to bend over, both for entertainment and physical exercise.
After a brief rest in the cold wind, they climbed to the patrol's target point and took a solemn oath with the national flag at the mouth of the mountain.
Behind them are snow-capped mountains, and in front of them are hundreds of miles of no man's land. They are the safest guardians of the country's gates.

Sixty percent increase in telecommunications network fraud crime in the first half of the year - Xinhua News Agency

According to the website of the Supreme Prosecutor's Office, in the first half of this year, the country's prosecutors prosecuted a total of 58,101 people for fraudulent crimes, an increase of 35% year-on-year.

In particular, fraudulent offenses are frequently committed in the prevention and control of epidemic conditions, and the number of fraudulent offenses prosecuted by procuratorial organs accounts for 43.4% of the total number of crimes in the prevention and control of epidemic conditions.

The Supreme People's Prosecutor's Office has been carrying out targeted guidance, and nine of the ten batches of typical cases involving epidemic prevention and control that have been published so far involve crimes of fraud.

From the first half of the year, the number of cases handled by procuratorial organs involving fraudulent crimes ranged from macroeconomic policies of the state to ordinary people's clothing, food and lodging, including fraud involving epidemics, fraud involving "medical care", fraud involving "health care products", fraud involving "enrollment intermediaries", fraud involving "schedule loans", fraud involving fraud involving obtaining state subsidies, fraud involving fraud involving the freezing of national assets, and so on.The scope of the cases concerned education, medical care, employment, retirement, social security, land requisition and demolition, precise poverty alleviation, financial credit, and so on.

In particular, some telecommunications network frauds break through national boundaries, geographical and personnel limitations, have the characteristics of involvement of the public, cross-border, remote, electronic payment, etc.

For example, some establish specialized companies, rent high-end office buildings, set up multiple departments or posts, use legitimate online platforms to advertise, recruit, train and evaluate recruiters, adopt business model management, dress in "legitimate clothes", and be more confusing.
It is the inalienable duty of procuratorial organs to punish and prevent crime in accordance with law, and to issue early warnings to the public and relevant departments in a timely manner.

In the administration of justice, procuratorial organs carry out their duties conscientiously, not only insisting on maintaining a high level of pressure on fraudulent crimes, but also targetedly fine-tuning various enforcement measures and promoting social governance through the issuance of procuratorial recommendations.

The procuratorial organs shall strictly examine the facts, evidence, procedures and application of the law in cases of arrest and prosecution of fraud, taking the facts as the basis and the law as the criterion, and do so in good faith.

Especially for the crime of telecommunication network fraud, we pay attention to the core role of electronic data in fact identification, and try to build the chain of evidence between electronic data, verbal evidence and written evidence.

In the case of an epidemic-related fraud case handled by the Yinzhou District Procuratorate of Ningbo City, Zhejiang Province, the procuratorial organ intervened early in the first place, from the case to the conclusion, taking only five days, demonstrating the attitude and determination to handle the case strictly and safeguard the stability of the social situation.

In the process of reviewing arrests and prosecutions, attention was paid to the prosecution of offenders who had omitted to report their cases, correcting 733 people who had omitted to report their cases to public security organs, and correcting 1,113 people who had omitted to report their cases to public security organs.

In the first half of the year, the national procuratorial organs issued 298 procuratorial recommendations against fraudulent crimes, promoting joint efforts to prevent fraudulent crimes and promote deep-level governance.

For example, the Guangzhou Procuratorate of Guangdong Province and the Dongguan City Procuratorate of Dongguan City of Guangdong Province, in response to the loopholes in the regulation of telecommunications networks found by telecommunications enterprises, banks and intermediary organizations, urge the relevant units to strengthen the regulation and improve the mechanisms to help promote the construction of an effective system.
Fourth, do your best to track down the stolen and damage the work.

The procuratorial organs at various places seize the important links of intervening in the investigation, guiding the taking of evidence, examining and prosecuting, urging the investigating organs to actively recover the stolen money, cooperating with the relevant departments to do a good job of recovering and damaging the stolen money, and striving to minimize the economic losses caused by fraudulent crimes to the people.

In the case of the Lin Road Loan case handled by the Beijing Public Prosecutor's Office, the case involved 22 sets of houses waiting to be sealed off.In the event that the houses might be dealt with beforehand in other cases, the first instituted the issuance of the Letter of Suspension of Enforcement, which was delivered to the relevant courts in a timely manner, recommending that the courts that had previously sealed off the houses concerned be delayed in enforcing them, pending the clarification of the facts of the crime and their unified disposition, so as to make the greatest efforts to recover the houses concerned and recover the losses of the victims.
The prosecutor reminded people to be very vigilant against fraudulent crimes, not to expect "the pie will fall in the sky", and not to believe in cheapness, and to keep their "money bag".
Lengna Town, Wenning County, Guizhou Province: Shortening the Apple Tree and Widening the Road to Poverty Alleviation - Zhongxin News Agency
A reporter from China Economic Daily - China Economic Network walks into Zhonghai Village in Yanna Town, Wenning County, Guizhou Province.
In the hot sun, the villager Li Yuanzhong hoes grass in the base, although his face is red, but he hums a few little songs from time to time in his mouth.

Because of its low latitude, high altitude, abundant sunlight and large difference in day and night temperatures, the apples produced contain high sugar content and good taste, and have a certain reputation in the surrounding area, but also because of the small head and many spots, it has not been able to sell a good price, and has not been able to form an industrial scale.
The town was once a poverty-stricken township known as "Baotani Yangimo De Chunqiu," where the incidence of poverty was as high as 25.8% a decade ago.

It is imperative to change traditional cultivation habits, adjust the industrial structure and increase farmers' incomes during the critical period when the fight against poverty and hunger is firmly on the way to a decisive victory.
After several visits by Chen Chao and a group of people in the town, Yunnan Town Party Committee believes that the development of industry can no longer go the old way.
For this reason, Yanna town introduced the leading enterprises, grow apples in a modern way.

Hou Jianwen, deputy general manager of Weining Beyond Agriculture Co., Ltd., came to Yanna Town from Shaanxi in 2015 to investigate the local planting conditions at a glance, and began to grow apple trees there in 2016.

At first, the village mobilized Li Yuanzhong to turn the land around and plant apple trees. Li Yuanzhong and his wife began to wonder, "I have grown apples for so many years, and I have not seen anyone in the village grow apples to make money.
"All the apples that are grown are dwarf apples. They don't make the apple tree grow too tall.

To Li Yuanzhong's surprise, a new method of apple cultivation was adopted. Irrigation pipes were laid under each apple tree, water and fertilizer were poured into the roots, and when the fruit was harvested in the autumn, the tractor went directly into the orchard and could pick it standing.

At present, the apple base has gradually entered a booming period, and the market is also as expected by Hou Jianwen, apples do not worry about selling, and are loved by consumers in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and other cities.
The growing apple industry has brought new changes to Li Yuanzhong's life. Although he is still cultivating the land, he has a new source of income.

Every year, in addition to the guaranteed land transfer fee, there is a profit dividend after the fruit hanging, and the couple usually work at the base, "one person can get 80 yuan a day, and always have a job."
Li Yuanzhong told reporters that last year, the profit margin was more than 2,800 yuan, plus the land transfer fee and the husband and wife's worker's income, the family earned more than 80,000 yuan.
"At present, we have seen first-hand results, with an annual yield of more than 150,000 yuan per acre of apples, about 10 times that of corn," he said.

Chen Chao told reporters that the entire town has planted 20,000 acres of apples, and there are 6,000 acres in Zhonghai Village alone, covering 4,056 farming households and 1,720,000 people, including 656 households and 2,952 people who are poor enough to build a business card, and pay more than 6 million yuan a year.
Li Yuanzhong, whose waistcoat is getting heavier and heavier, is also beginning to realize his "wishes".
"I still have a dozen acres of land at home, and when the next step is to expand the Apple base, all of it will be transferred to them, which will give them more income," he said.

Membrane separation technology helps crack the "greenhouse effect" - China News Agency
Membrane Separation Technology Helps to Defeat the "Greenhouse Effect"
Illustration of Preparation Technology of New Mixed Matrix Film

Tianjin University's Atmospheric Environment and Bioenergy Team has made significant progress in the field of membrane separation for capturing carbon dioxide, and has successfully developed a new mixed matrix membrane preparation technology that greatly improves the capturing capability of carbon dioxide in membrane materials.
The results have been published on the cover of the international journal Greenhouse Gases: Science and Technology.
The "greenhouse effect" is a major environmental problem that plagues human development, and carbon dioxide emissions are the culprits of the "greenhouse effect".
How to efficiently capture and use carbon dioxide from human emissions is the focus of scientists' attention.

"Membrane separation" is an emerging technology of carbon dioxide capture. It separates carbon dioxide gas with the help of membrane materials, and has the characteristics of efficient energy saving and simple operation.
The bottleneck of capturing carbon dioxide by membrane separation is how to let the membrane material breathe deeply and improve the gas separation efficiency.
The research team of Tianjin University explored the influence of different solvents on membrane gas separation properties through repeated experiments.

Experimental results show that N-methylpyrrolactone as a solvent produces a more even distribution of carbon nanotubes in the membrane material and "more permeable", which effectively improves the gas separation efficiency and rate of the membrane material.
The carbon dioxide separation properties of mixed matrix membranes prepared with this new technology are close to the theoretical separation limits of such membrane materials.
"The new technology provides a new way of capturing carbon dioxide by membrane separation," he said.

Li Lun, a member of Tianjin University's Atmospheric Environment and Bioenergy team, said: "We hope this technology will provide strong support for future coal-fired power plants and chemical companies to handle flue gas and play a major role in controlling greenhouse gas emissions.
Find out what is the professional grade difference before filling out the volunteer form-CNN
Chongqing Morning Post | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |
Before filling out the form, get to know what is the professional grade difference
Every year, students or parents who do not know the noun involved in the application of the entrance examination volunteer, and thus affect the application of the volunteer.

This year, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing University of Science and Technology, Beijing Postal and Telecommunication University, Beijing Forestry University, and Beijing Chemical University jointly issued admission policies for 2020, eliminating the difference in professional grades.
What does professional grade difference mean and what is its significance in volunteering?
There are three types of professional allocation rules

Experts reminded that before filling out the application form, you must read carefully the Admission Regulations of the College of Hearts and Minds, and understand the admission rules of universities, including filing ratio, specialty allocation rules, etc.
The specialty allocation rule refers to the three ways of specialty priority, grade priority and grade difference for specialty admission after university filing.
Which method is used by the universities will be specified in the Admissions Regulations.
However, there are some universities admission principle is the total priority, there is no grade difference between majors.

If the student fails to reach the 1st Professional Volunteer Admission Point Line, he/she will be considered to have reached the 2nd Professional Volunteer Admission Point Line, and so on until he/she is admitted to the last Professional Volunteer.

In order to determine the admission of volunteer candidates in different specialties, the institutions, when arranging candidates' specialties, according to one or more points published in the admission regulations, such points are called "specialty grade difference".

This is the difference in grades between the first and non-first professional volunteers, and the difference in grades between the first and non-first professional volunteers, such as 3, 2, 1, and so on.
For example.

Assume that the student Xiao Ming registered for A universities, took 560 marks, their professional volunteers are: computer, international trade, automation, mechanical engineering, e-commerce, A university's professional admission practices the method of professional grade difference, the grade difference is divided into 2 points, 1 point, 1 point, 0 points.

If he fails, his score will be reduced by 2 points, and he will be ranked according to his score of 558 points with the candidates who have applied for International Trade in the first major.If he fails, his score will be reduced by 1 point (i.e., 557 points) for the "automated" admission of the third major.If he fails, his score will be reduced by 1 point (i.e., 556 points) for the admission of the fourth major.
Different colleges and universities have different degree levels

With the popularization of parallel volunteering, many universities have now abolished the professional grade difference, but this year, some universities still retain this method, according to the Admissions Regulations issued by the universities, more than 20 universities have set the professional grade difference this year.

For example, Sichuan Agricultural University, Shandong University of Science and Technology, Heilongjiang University of Chinese Medicine, Jiangsu University of Science and Technology, Jiangxi Normal University, Chengdu Medical College, Northeast Electric Power University, Jimei University, Nanjing Medical University, Nanjing Industrial University, Ningxia University, Shandong University of Science and Technology, China Civil Aviation Flight Academy, etc.
In these universities, each university sets a different professional grade difference.

Some universities have grading differences for each major, such as Ningxia University, where the files have been submitted to the candidates, according to the order of the candidates volunteering for the major, decreasing one point after another in order of admission scores.
Some universities have different degrees for different subjects.

For example, at the University of Chicago, there is a four-point difference in the overall grade of the Professional Volunteer, i.e., a three-point difference between the First Professional Volunteer and the other Professional Volunteers, no grade difference between the other Professional Volunteers, and a one-point difference between the other Professional Volunteers and the Adjustment Professional Volunteers.

When filling out the application, candidates and parents must carefully read the admission policy of the reported schools, see if there are any specialty grade differences, the form of grade differences, while fully considering the scores, also have a reasonable analysis of the proposed school and specialty. If the institutions in the admission regulations clearly adopt a grade difference in the way of admission, candidates should pay attention to the gradient between the various specialties when choosing a specialty, to increase the admission rate.

This year, her children have successfully graduated and are employed, and she herself has got a job and income after participating in skill training, and has been out of poverty by the end of April.

It is reported that Dongchuan District General Organization to help combat poverty and strengthen special skills training project, is part of the Yunnan Provincial General Trade Union skills training work.

The district summarized the characteristics of the hard-working workers in the district who could easily help with poverty alleviation and resettlement, conducted in-depth investigations to understand the training needs and determined the types of training, and planned to train 450 people in the near future, including electricians, welders and spotters.
Recently, Agricultural Bank of Yunnan Menglian County branch staff member Li Yi to the county union wrote a heartfelt thank you letter.
In her letter, she expressed her sincere gratitude to the union for the financial support she received from August 2013 to January 2017 to help her complete her studies.
In 2004, Li Yi's father died in a car accident, and her mother was included in the hard-working staff file.
With the help of the local trade union, Li Yi completed her schooling successfully.
Since 2016, 3809 households have been lifted out of poverty through the system of guarantees and precise assistance.
The successful emancipation of the Luling family and Li Yi is an epitome of the Yunnan Trade Union's promotion of the emancipation of difficult workers.

According to the introduction of Yunnan Provincial General Trade Union Law and Human Rights Protection Department Staff Section Kai Yuan, the provincial general strengthened the dynamic management of hardship workers' files, promoted normalization of filing work, timely integration of hardship workers who meet the filing requirements into the support system; broadened the application channels for hardship workers, using WeChat to open the online application hardship workers filing service platform, facilitated hardship workers to promptly voluntarily declare.

During the epidemic, Yunnan province allocated more than 13 million yuan to send warmth funds to help workers with difficulties in workplaces to alleviate the pressure on their lives.In accordance with the standard of 2,000 yuan per household for workers with difficulties in workplaces at the national level and 1,500 yuan per household for workers with difficulties in workplaces at the provincial level, more than 6,000 households at the national level and more than 1,000 households at the provincial level implemented special warmth condolence activities for workers with difficulties in workplaces.

At the same time, the provincial headquarters interacts with the departments of human rights and social welfare and various Internet recruitment platforms such as Jilian Recruiting, pushing the recruitment information to workers in difficulty, and providing employment advice, employment guidance and other services.
